# ============================================================================
# SYSTEM_TIME (ID 2)
# The system time is the time of the sender's master clock. This can be
# emitted by flight controllers, onboard computers, or other components in
# the MAVLink network. Components that are using a less reliable time
# source, such as a battery-backed real time clock, can choose to match
# their system clock to that of a system that indicates a more recent time.
# This allows more broadly accurate date stamping of logs, and so on. If
# precise time synchronization is needed then use TIMESYNC instead.
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> SYSTEM_TIME LITTLE_ENDIAN "The system time is the time of the sender's master clock. This can be emitted by flight controlle..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 2} %>
  APPEND_ITEM TIME_UNIX_USEC 64 UINT "Timestamp (UNIX epoch time)."
    UNITS "Microseconds" us
  APPEND_ITEM TIME_BOOT_MS 32 UINT "Timestamp (time since system boot)."
    UNITS "Milliseconds" ms
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# PARAM_REQUEST_READ (ID 20)
# Request to read the onboard parameter with the param_id string id. Onboard
# parameters are stored as key[const char*] -> value[float]. This allows to
# send a parameter to any other component (such as the GCS) without the need
# of previous knowledge of possible parameter names. Thus the same GCS can
# store different parameters for different autopilots. See also
# https://mavlink.io/en/services/parameter.html for a full documentation of
# QGroundControl and IMU code.
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> PARAM_REQUEST_READ LITTLE_ENDIAN "Request to read the onboard parameter with the param_id string id. Onboard parameters are stored ..."

  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_COMPONENT 8 UINT "Component ID"

  APPEND_ITEM PARAM_INDEX 16 INT "Parameter index. Send -1 to use the param ID field as identifier (else the pa..."
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

    STATE MAV_PARAM_TYPE_UINT8 1
    STATE MAV_PARAM_TYPE_INT8 2
    STATE MAV_PARAM_TYPE_UINT16 3
    STATE MAV_PARAM_TYPE_INT16 4
    STATE MAV_PARAM_TYPE_UINT32 5
    STATE MAV_PARAM_TYPE_INT32 6
    STATE MAV_PARAM_TYPE_UINT64 7
    STATE MAV_PARAM_TYPE_INT64 8
    STATE MAV_PARAM_TYPE_REAL32 9

# ============================================================================
# PARAM_SET (ID 23)
# Set a parameter value (write new value to permanent storage). The
# receiving component should acknowledge the new parameter value by
# broadcasting a PARAM_VALUE message (broadcasting ensures that multiple GCS
# all have an up-to-date list of all parameters). If the sending GCS did not
# receive a PARAM_VALUE within its timeout time, it should re-send the
# PARAM_SET message. The parameter microservice is documented at
# https://mavlink.io/en/services/parameter.html.
# ============================================================================

  APPEND_ITEM PARAM_VALUE 32 FLOAT "Onboard parameter value"
  APPEND_ITEM PARAM_TYPE 8 UINT "Onboard parameter type."
    STATE MAV_PARAM_TYPE_UINT8 1
    STATE MAV_PARAM_TYPE_INT8 2
    STATE MAV_PARAM_TYPE_UINT16 3
    STATE MAV_PARAM_TYPE_INT16 4
    STATE MAV_PARAM_TYPE_UINT32 5
    STATE MAV_PARAM_TYPE_INT32 6
    STATE MAV_PARAM_TYPE_UINT64 7

# The attitude in the aeronautical frame (right-handed, Z-down, X-front,
# Y-right), expressed as quaternion. Quaternion order is w, x, y, z and a
# zero rotation would be expressed as (1 0 0 0).
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> ATTITUDE_QUATERNION LITTLE_ENDIAN "The attitude in the aeronautical frame (right-handed, Z-down, X-front, Y-right), expressed as qua..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 31} %>
  APPEND_ITEM TIME_BOOT_MS 32 UINT "Timestamp (time since system boot)."
    UNITS "Milliseconds" ms
  APPEND_ITEM Q1 32 FLOAT "Quaternion component 1, w (1 in null-rotation)"
  APPEND_ITEM Q2 32 FLOAT "Quaternion component 2, x (0 in null-rotation)"
  APPEND_ITEM Q3 32 FLOAT "Quaternion component 3, y (0 in null-rotation)"
  APPEND_ITEM Q4 32 FLOAT "Quaternion component 4, z (0 in null-rotation)"
  APPEND_ITEM ROLLSPEED 32 FLOAT "Roll angular speed"
    UNITS "Radians_per_second" rad/s
  APPEND_ITEM PITCHSPEED 32 FLOAT "Pitch angular speed"
    UNITS "Radians_per_second" rad/s
  APPEND_ITEM YAWSPEED 32 FLOAT "Yaw angular speed"
    UNITS "Radians_per_second" rad/s
  # MAVLink 2 Extension Fields
  APPEND_ARRAY_ITEM REPR_OFFSET_Q 32 FLOAT 128 "Rotation offset by which the attitude quaternion and angular speed vector sho..."
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# RC_CHANNELS_RAW (ID 35)
# The RAW values of the RC channels received. The standard PPM modulation is

# UINT16_MAX implies the channel is unused. Individual
# receivers/transmitters might violate this specification.
# ============================================================================

    UNITS "Milliseconds" ms

  APPEND_ITEM CHAN1_RAW 16 UINT "RC channel 1 value."
    UNITS "Microseconds" us
  APPEND_ITEM CHAN2_RAW 16 UINT "RC channel 2 value."
    UNITS "Microseconds" us
  APPEND_ITEM CHAN3_RAW 16 UINT "RC channel 3 value."
    UNITS "Microseconds" us
  APPEND_ITEM CHAN4_RAW 16 UINT "RC channel 4 value."
    UNITS "Microseconds" us
  APPEND_ITEM CHAN5_RAW 16 UINT "RC channel 5 value."
    UNITS "Microseconds" us
  APPEND_ITEM CHAN6_RAW 16 UINT "RC channel 6 value."
    UNITS "Microseconds" us
  APPEND_ITEM CHAN7_RAW 16 UINT "RC channel 7 value."
    UNITS "Microseconds" us
  APPEND_ITEM CHAN8_RAW 16 UINT "RC channel 8 value."
    UNITS "Microseconds" us
  APPEND_ITEM RSSI 8 UINT "Receive signal strength indicator in device-dependent units/scale. Values: [0..."
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# MISSION_ITEM (ID 39)
# Message encoding a mission item. This message is emitted to announce the
# presence of a mission item and to set a mission item on the system. The
# mission item can be either in x, y, z meters (type: LOCAL) or x:lat,
# y:lon, z:altitude. Local frame is Z-down, right handed (NED), global frame
# is Z-up, right handed (ENU). NaN may be used to indicate an
# optional/default value (e.g. to use the system's current latitude or yaw
# rather than a specific value). See also
# https://mavlink.io/en/services/mission.html.
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> MISSION_ITEM LITTLE_ENDIAN "Message encoding a mission item. This message is emitted to announce the presence of a mission it..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 39} %>
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_SYSTEM 8 UINT "System ID"
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_COMPONENT 8 UINT "Component ID"
  APPEND_ITEM SEQ 16 UINT "Sequence"
  APPEND_ITEM FRAME 8 UINT "The coordinate system of the waypoint."
  APPEND_ITEM COMMAND 16 UINT "The scheduled action for the waypoint."
  APPEND_ITEM CURRENT 8 UINT "false:0, true:1"
  APPEND_ITEM AUTOCONTINUE 8 UINT "Autocontinue to next waypoint. 0: false, 1: true. Set false to pause mission ..."
  APPEND_ITEM PARAM1 32 FLOAT "PARAM1, see MAV_CMD enum"
  APPEND_ITEM PARAM2 32 FLOAT "PARAM2, see MAV_CMD enum"
  APPEND_ITEM PARAM3 32 FLOAT "PARAM3, see MAV_CMD enum"
  APPEND_ITEM PARAM4 32 FLOAT "PARAM4, see MAV_CMD enum"
  APPEND_ITEM X 32 FLOAT "PARAM5 / local: X coordinate, global: latitude"
  APPEND_ITEM Y 32 FLOAT "PARAM6 / local: Y coordinate, global: longitude"
  APPEND_ITEM Z 32 FLOAT "PARAM7 / local: Z coordinate, global: altitude (relative or absolute, dependi..."
  # MAVLink 2 Extension Fields
  APPEND_ITEM MISSION_TYPE 8 UINT "Mission type."
    STATE MAV_MISSION_TYPE_MISSION 0
    STATE MAV_MISSION_TYPE_FENCE 1
    STATE MAV_MISSION_TYPE_RALLY 2
    STATE MAV_MISSION_TYPE_ALL 255
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# MISSION_SET_CURRENT (ID 41)
# Set the mission item with sequence number seq as the current item and emit
# MISSION_CURRENT (whether or not the mission number changed). If a mission
# is currently being executed, the system will continue to this new mission
# item on the shortest path, skipping any intermediate mission items. Note
# that mission jump repeat counters are not reset (see MAV_CMD_DO_JUMP
# param2). This message may trigger a mission state-machine change on some
# systems: for example from MISSION_STATE_NOT_STARTED or
# MISSION_STATE_PAUSED to MISSION_STATE_ACTIVE. If the system is in mission
# mode, on those systems this command might therefore start, restart or
# resume the mission. If the system is not in mission mode this message must
# not trigger a switch to mission mode.
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> MISSION_SET_CURRENT LITTLE_ENDIAN "Set the mission item with sequence number seq as the current item and emit MISSION_CURRENT (wheth..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 41} %>
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_SYSTEM 8 UINT "System ID"
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_COMPONENT 8 UINT "Component ID"
  APPEND_ITEM SEQ 16 UINT "Sequence"
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

  APPEND_ITEM SEQ 16 UINT "Sequence"
  # MAVLink 2 Extension Fields

  APPEND_ITEM MISSION_STATE 8 UINT "Mission state machine state. MISSION_STATE_UNKNOWN if state reporting not sup..."
    STATE MISSION_STATE_UNKNOWN 0
    STATE MISSION_STATE_NO_MISSION 1
    STATE MISSION_STATE_NOT_STARTED 2
    STATE MISSION_STATE_ACTIVE 3
    STATE MISSION_STATE_PAUSED 4
    STATE MISSION_STATE_COMPLETE 5
  APPEND_ITEM MISSION_MODE 8 UINT "Vehicle is in a mode that can execute mission items or suspended. 0: Unknown,..."
  APPEND_ITEM MISSION_ID 32 UINT "Id of current on-vehicle mission plan, or 0 if IDs are not supported or there..."
  APPEND_ITEM FENCE_ID 32 UINT "Id of current on-vehicle fence plan, or 0 if IDs are not supported or there i..."
  APPEND_ITEM RALLY_POINTS_ID 32 UINT "Id of current on-vehicle rally point plan, or 0 if IDs are not supported or t..."

# ============================================================================

    STATE MAV_MISSION_ERROR 1
    STATE MAV_MISSION_UNSUPPORTED_FRAME 2
    STATE MAV_MISSION_UNSUPPORTED 3
    STATE MAV_MISSION_NO_SPACE 4
    STATE MAV_MISSION_INVALID 5
    STATE MAV_MISSION_INVALID_PARAM1 6
    STATE MAV_MISSION_INVALID_PARAM2 7
    STATE MAV_MISSION_INVALID_PARAM3 8
    STATE MAV_MISSION_INVALID_PARAM4 9
    STATE MAV_MISSION_INVALID_PARAM5_X 10
    STATE MAV_MISSION_INVALID_PARAM6_Y 11
    STATE MAV_MISSION_INVALID_PARAM7 12
    STATE MAV_MISSION_INVALID_SEQUENCE 13
    STATE MAV_MISSION_DENIED 14
  # MAVLink 2 Extension Fields
  APPEND_ITEM MISSION_TYPE 8 UINT "Mission type."
    STATE MAV_MISSION_TYPE_MISSION 0
    STATE MAV_MISSION_TYPE_FENCE 1
    STATE MAV_MISSION_TYPE_RALLY 2
    STATE MAV_MISSION_TYPE_ALL 255
  APPEND_ITEM OPAQUE_ID 32 UINT "Id of new on-vehicle mission, fence, or rally point plan (on upload to vehicl..."

    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# SET_GPS_GLOBAL_ORIGIN (ID 48)
# Sets the GPS coordinates of the vehicle local origin (0,0,0) position.
# Vehicle should emit GPS_GLOBAL_ORIGIN irrespective of whether the origin
# is changed. This enables transform between the local coordinate frame and
# the global (GPS) coordinate frame, which may be necessary when (for
# example) indoor and outdoor settings are connected and the MAV should move
# from in- to outdoor.
# ============================================================================

  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 48} %>

    UNITS "Degrees_E7" degE7
  APPEND_ITEM LONGITUDE 32 INT "Longitude (WGS84)"
    UNITS "Degrees_E7" degE7
  APPEND_ITEM ALTITUDE 32 INT "Altitude (MSL). Positive for up."
    UNITS "Millimeters" mm
  # MAVLink 2 Extension Fields
  APPEND_ITEM TIME_USEC 64 UINT "Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can ..."
    UNITS "Microseconds" us
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

  APPEND_ITEM PARAM_VALUE0 32 FLOAT "Initial parameter value"
  APPEND_ITEM SCALE 32 FLOAT "Scale, maps the RC range [-1, 1] to a parameter value"
  APPEND_ITEM PARAM_VALUE_MIN 32 FLOAT "Minimum param value. The protocol does not define if this overwrites an onboa..."
  APPEND_ITEM PARAM_VALUE_MAX 32 FLOAT "Maximum param value. The protocol does not define if this overwrites an onboa..."
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

    STATE MAV_MISSION_TYPE_MISSION 0
    STATE MAV_MISSION_TYPE_FENCE 1
    STATE MAV_MISSION_TYPE_RALLY 2
    STATE MAV_MISSION_TYPE_ALL 255
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================

    UNITS "Meters" m
  APPEND_ITEM P1Y 32 FLOAT "y position 1 / Longitude 1"
    UNITS "Meters" m
  APPEND_ITEM P1Z 32 FLOAT "z position 1 / Altitude 1"
    UNITS "Meters" m
  APPEND_ITEM P2X 32 FLOAT "x position 2 / Latitude 2"
    UNITS "Meters" m
  APPEND_ITEM P2Y 32 FLOAT "y position 2 / Longitude 2"
    UNITS "Meters" m
  APPEND_ITEM P2Z 32 FLOAT "z position 2 / Altitude 2"
    UNITS "Meters" m
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

    STATE MAV_ESTIMATOR_TYPE_VIO 3

    UNITS "Meters_per_second" m/s

  APPEND_ITEM R 16 INT "R-axis, normalized to the range [-1000,1000]. A value of INT16_MAX indicates ..."

# ============================================================================
# MISSION_ITEM_INT (ID 73)
# Message encoding a mission item. This message is emitted to announce the
# presence of a mission item and to set a mission item on the system. The
# mission item can be either in x, y, z meters (type: LOCAL) or x:lat,
# y:lon, z:altitude. Local frame is Z-down, right handed (NED), global frame
# is Z-up, right handed (ENU). NaN or INT32_MAX may be used in float/integer
# params (respectively) to indicate optional/default values (e.g. to use the
# component's current latitude, yaw rather than a specific value). See also
# https://mavlink.io/en/services/mission.html.
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> MISSION_ITEM_INT LITTLE_ENDIAN "Message encoding a mission item. This message is emitted to announce the presence of a mission it..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 73} %>
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_SYSTEM 8 UINT "System ID"
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_COMPONENT 8 UINT "Component ID"
  APPEND_ITEM SEQ 16 UINT "Waypoint ID (sequence number). Starts at zero. Increases monotonically for ea..."
  APPEND_ITEM FRAME 8 UINT "The coordinate system of the waypoint."
  APPEND_ITEM COMMAND 16 UINT "The scheduled action for the waypoint."
  APPEND_ITEM CURRENT 8 UINT "false:0, true:1"
  APPEND_ITEM AUTOCONTINUE 8 UINT "Autocontinue to next waypoint. 0: false, 1: true. Set false to pause mission ..."
  APPEND_ITEM PARAM1 32 FLOAT "PARAM1, see MAV_CMD enum"
  APPEND_ITEM PARAM2 32 FLOAT "PARAM2, see MAV_CMD enum"
  APPEND_ITEM PARAM3 32 FLOAT "PARAM3, see MAV_CMD enum"
  APPEND_ITEM PARAM4 32 FLOAT "PARAM4, see MAV_CMD enum"
  APPEND_ITEM X 32 INT "PARAM5 / local: x position in meters * 1e4, global: latitude in degrees * 10^7"
  APPEND_ITEM Y 32 INT "PARAM6 / y position: local: x position in meters * 1e4, global: longitude in ..."
  APPEND_ITEM Z 32 FLOAT "PARAM7 / z position: global: altitude in meters (relative or absolute, depend..."
  # MAVLink 2 Extension Fields
  APPEND_ITEM MISSION_TYPE 8 UINT "Mission type."
    STATE MAV_MISSION_TYPE_MISSION 0
    STATE MAV_MISSION_TYPE_FENCE 1
    STATE MAV_MISSION_TYPE_RALLY 2
    STATE MAV_MISSION_TYPE_ALL 255
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# COMMAND_INT (ID 75)
# Send a command with up to seven parameters to the MAV, where params 5 and
# 6 are integers and the other values are floats. This is preferred over
# COMMAND_LONG as it allows the MAV_FRAME to be specified for interpreting
# positional information, such as altitude. COMMAND_INT is also preferred
# when sending latitude and longitude data in params 5 and 6, as it allows
# for greater precision. Param 5 and 6 encode positional data as scaled
# integers, where the scaling depends on the actual command value. NaN or
# INT32_MAX may be used in float/integer params (respectively) to indicate
# optional/default values (e.g. to use the component's current latitude, yaw
# rather than a specific value). The command microservice is documented at
# https://mavlink.io/en/services/command.html
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> COMMAND_INT LITTLE_ENDIAN "Send a command with up to seven parameters to the MAV, where params 5 and 6 are integers and the ..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 75} %>
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_SYSTEM 8 UINT "System ID"
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_COMPONENT 8 UINT "Component ID"
  APPEND_ITEM FRAME 8 UINT "The coordinate system of the COMMAND."
  APPEND_ITEM COMMAND 16 UINT "The scheduled action for the mission item."
  APPEND_ITEM CURRENT 8 UINT "Not used."
  APPEND_ITEM AUTOCONTINUE 8 UINT "Not used (set 0)."
  APPEND_ITEM PARAM1 32 FLOAT "PARAM1, see MAV_CMD enum"
  APPEND_ITEM PARAM2 32 FLOAT "PARAM2, see MAV_CMD enum"
  APPEND_ITEM PARAM3 32 FLOAT "PARAM3, see MAV_CMD enum"
  APPEND_ITEM PARAM4 32 FLOAT "PARAM4, see MAV_CMD enum"
  APPEND_ITEM X 32 INT "PARAM5 / local: x position in meters * 1e4, global: latitude in degrees * 10^7"
  APPEND_ITEM Y 32 INT "PARAM6 / local: y position in meters * 1e4, global: longitude in degrees * 10^7"
  APPEND_ITEM Z 32 FLOAT "PARAM7 / z position: global: altitude in meters (relative or absolute, depend..."
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# COMMAND_LONG (ID 76)
# Send a command with up to seven parameters to the MAV. COMMAND_INT is
# generally preferred when sending MAV_CMD commands that include positional
# information; it offers higher precision and allows the MAV_FRAME to be
# specified (which may otherwise be ambiguous, particularly for altitude).
# The command microservice is documented at
# https://mavlink.io/en/services/command.html
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> COMMAND_LONG LITTLE_ENDIAN "Send a command with up to seven parameters to the MAV. COMMAND_INT is generally preferred when se..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 76} %>
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_SYSTEM 8 UINT "System which should execute the command"
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_COMPONENT 8 UINT "Component which should execute the command, 0 for all components"
  APPEND_ITEM COMMAND 16 UINT "Command ID (of command to send)."
  APPEND_ITEM CONFIRMATION 8 UINT "0: First transmission of this command. 1-255: Confirmation transmissions (e.g..."
  APPEND_ITEM PARAM1 32 FLOAT "Parameter 1 (for the specific command)."
  APPEND_ITEM PARAM2 32 FLOAT "Parameter 2 (for the specific command)."
  APPEND_ITEM PARAM3 32 FLOAT "Parameter 3 (for the specific command)."
  APPEND_ITEM PARAM4 32 FLOAT "Parameter 4 (for the specific command)."
  APPEND_ITEM PARAM5 32 FLOAT "Parameter 5 (for the specific command)."
  APPEND_ITEM PARAM6 32 FLOAT "Parameter 6 (for the specific command)."
  APPEND_ITEM PARAM7 32 FLOAT "Parameter 7 (for the specific command)."
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# COMMAND_ACK (ID 77)
# Report status of a command. Includes feedback whether the command was
# executed. The command microservice is documented at
# https://mavlink.io/en/services/command.html
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> COMMAND_ACK LITTLE_ENDIAN "Report status of a command. Includes feedback whether the command was executed. The command micro..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 77} %>
  APPEND_ITEM COMMAND 16 UINT "Command ID (of acknowledged command)."
  APPEND_ITEM RESULT 8 UINT "Result of command."
    STATE MAV_RESULT_ACCEPTED 0
    STATE MAV_RESULT_TEMPORARILY_REJECTED 1
    STATE MAV_RESULT_DENIED 2
    STATE MAV_RESULT_UNSUPPORTED 3
    STATE MAV_RESULT_FAILED 4
    STATE MAV_RESULT_IN_PROGRESS 5
    STATE MAV_RESULT_CANCELLED 6
    STATE MAV_RESULT_COMMAND_LONG_ONLY 7
    STATE MAV_RESULT_COMMAND_INT_ONLY 8
    STATE MAV_RESULT_COMMAND_UNSUPPORTED_MAV_FRAME 9
    STATE MAV_RESULT_NOT_IN_CONTROL 10
  # MAVLink 2 Extension Fields
  APPEND_ITEM PROGRESS 8 UINT "The progress percentage when result is MAV_RESULT_IN_PROGRESS. Values: [0-100..."
    UNITS "Percent" %
  APPEND_ITEM RESULT_PARAM2 32 INT "Additional result information. Can be set with a command-specific enum contai..."
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_SYSTEM 8 UINT "System ID of the target recipient. This is the ID of the system that sent the..."
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_COMPONENT 8 UINT "Component ID of the target recipient. This is the ID of the system that sent ..."
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# COMMAND_CANCEL (ID 80)
# Cancel a long running command. The target system should respond with a
# COMMAND_ACK to the original command with result=MAV_RESULT_CANCELLED if
# the long running process was cancelled. If it has already completed, the
# cancel action can be ignored. The cancel action can be retried until some
# sort of acknowledgement to the original command has been received. The
# command microservice is documented at
# https://mavlink.io/en/services/command.html
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> COMMAND_CANCEL LITTLE_ENDIAN "Cancel a long running command. The target system should respond with a COMMAND_ACK to the origina..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 80} %>
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_SYSTEM 8 UINT "System executing long running command. Should not be broadcast (0)."
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_COMPONENT 8 UINT "Component executing long running command."
  APPEND_ITEM COMMAND 16 UINT "Command ID (of command to cancel)."
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# MANUAL_SETPOINT (ID 81)
# Setpoint in roll, pitch, yaw and thrust from the operator
# ============================================================================

    UNITS "Milliseconds" ms
  APPEND_ITEM ROLL 32 FLOAT "Desired roll rate"
    UNITS "Radians_per_second" rad/s
  APPEND_ITEM PITCH 32 FLOAT "Desired pitch rate"
    UNITS "Radians_per_second" rad/s
  APPEND_ITEM YAW 32 FLOAT "Desired yaw rate"
    UNITS "Radians_per_second" rad/s
  APPEND_ITEM THRUST 32 FLOAT "Collective thrust, normalized to 0 .. 1"
  APPEND_ITEM MODE_SWITCH 8 UINT "Flight mode switch position, 0.. 255"
  APPEND_ITEM MANUAL_OVERRIDE_SWITCH 8 UINT "Override mode switch position, 0.. 255"
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

    UNITS "Meters" m

  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 90} %>
  APPEND_ITEM TIME_USEC 64 UINT "Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can ..."
    UNITS "Microseconds" us

    UNITS "Radians" rad
  APPEND_ITEM PITCH 32 FLOAT "Pitch angle"
    UNITS "Radians" rad
  APPEND_ITEM YAW 32 FLOAT "Yaw angle"
    UNITS "Radians" rad
  APPEND_ITEM ROLLSPEED 32 FLOAT "Body frame roll / phi angular speed"
    UNITS "Radians_per_second" rad/s
  APPEND_ITEM PITCHSPEED 32 FLOAT "Body frame pitch / theta angular speed"
    UNITS "Radians_per_second" rad/s
  APPEND_ITEM YAWSPEED 32 FLOAT "Body frame yaw / psi angular speed"
    UNITS "Radians_per_second" rad/s
  APPEND_ITEM LAT 32 INT "Latitude"
    UNITS "Degrees_E7" degE7
  APPEND_ITEM LON 32 INT "Longitude"
    UNITS "Degrees_E7" degE7
  APPEND_ITEM ALT 32 INT "Altitude"
    UNITS "Millimeters" mm
  APPEND_ITEM VX 16 INT "Ground X Speed (Latitude)"
    UNITS "Centimeters_per_second" cm/s
  APPEND_ITEM VY 16 INT "Ground Y Speed (Longitude)"
    UNITS "Centimeters_per_second" cm/s
  APPEND_ITEM VZ 16 INT "Ground Z Speed (Altitude)"
    UNITS "Centimeters_per_second" cm/s
  APPEND_ITEM XACC 16 INT "X acceleration"
    UNITS "Millig" mG
  APPEND_ITEM YACC 16 INT "Y acceleration"
    UNITS "Millig" mG
  APPEND_ITEM ZACC 16 INT "Z acceleration"
    UNITS "Millig" mG
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

  APPEND_ITEM AUX1 32 FLOAT "Aux 1, -1 .. 1"
  APPEND_ITEM AUX2 32 FLOAT "Aux 2, -1 .. 1"
  APPEND_ITEM AUX3 32 FLOAT "Aux 3, -1 .. 1"
  APPEND_ITEM AUX4 32 FLOAT "Aux 4, -1 .. 1"

    STATE MAV_MODE_PREFLIGHT 0
    STATE MAV_MODE_STABILIZE_DISARMED 80
    STATE MAV_MODE_STABILIZE_ARMED 208
    STATE MAV_MODE_MANUAL_DISARMED 64
    STATE MAV_MODE_MANUAL_ARMED 192
    STATE MAV_MODE_GUIDED_DISARMED 88
    STATE MAV_MODE_GUIDED_ARMED 216
    STATE MAV_MODE_AUTO_DISARMED 92
    STATE MAV_MODE_AUTO_ARMED 220
    STATE MAV_MODE_TEST_DISARMED 66
    STATE MAV_MODE_TEST_ARMED 194
  APPEND_ITEM NAV_MODE 8 UINT "Navigation mode (MAV_NAV_MODE)"
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# HIL_RC_INPUTS_RAW (ID 92)
# Sent from simulation to autopilot. The RAW values of the RC channels
# received. The standard PPM modulation is as follows: 1000 microseconds:
# 0%, 2000 microseconds: 100%. Individual receivers/transmitters might
# violate this specification.
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> HIL_RC_INPUTS_RAW LITTLE_ENDIAN "Sent from simulation to autopilot. The RAW values of the RC channels received. The standard PPM m..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 92} %>
  APPEND_ITEM TIME_USEC 64 UINT "Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can ..."
    UNITS "Microseconds" us
  APPEND_ITEM CHAN1_RAW 16 UINT "RC channel 1 value"
    UNITS "Microseconds" us
  APPEND_ITEM CHAN2_RAW 16 UINT "RC channel 2 value"
    UNITS "Microseconds" us
  APPEND_ITEM CHAN3_RAW 16 UINT "RC channel 3 value"
    UNITS "Microseconds" us
  APPEND_ITEM CHAN4_RAW 16 UINT "RC channel 4 value"

# ============================================================================
# TIMESYNC (ID 111)
# Time synchronization message. The message is used for both timesync
# requests and responses. The request is sent with `ts1=syncing component
# timestamp` and `tc1=0`, and may be broadcast or targeted to a specific
# system/component. The response is sent with `ts1=syncing component
# timestamp` (mirror back unchanged), and `tc1=responding component
# timestamp`, with the `target_system` and `target_component` set to ids of
# the original request. Systems can determine if they are receiving a
# request or response based on the value of `tc`. If the response has
# `target_system==target_component==0` the remote system has not been
# updated to use the component IDs and cannot reliably timesync; the
# requester may report an error. Timestamps are UNIX Epoch time or time
# since system boot in nanoseconds (the timestamp format can be inferred by
# checking for the magnitude of the number; generally it doesn't matter as
# only the offset is used). The message sequence is repeated numerous times
# with results being filtered/averaged to estimate the offset. See also:
# https://mavlink.io/en/services/timesync.html.
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> TIMESYNC LITTLE_ENDIAN "Time synchronization message. The message is used for both timesync requests and responses. The r..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 111} %>
  APPEND_ITEM TC1 64 INT "Time sync timestamp 1. Syncing: 0. Responding: Timestamp of responding compon..."
    UNITS "ns" ns
  APPEND_ITEM TS1 64 INT "Time sync timestamp 2. Timestamp of syncing component (mirrored in response)."
    UNITS "ns" ns
  # MAVLink 2 Extension Fields
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_SYSTEM 8 UINT "Target system id. Request: 0 (broadcast) or id of specific system. Response m..."
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_COMPONENT 8 UINT "Target component id. Request: 0 (broadcast) or id of specific component. Resp..."
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# CAMERA_TRIGGER (ID 112)
# Camera-IMU triggering and synchronisation message.

  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 112} %>
  APPEND_ITEM TIME_USEC 64 UINT "Timestamp for image frame (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The re..."
    UNITS "Microseconds" us
  APPEND_ITEM SEQ 32 UINT "Image frame sequence"
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

    UNITS "Centimeters_per_second" cm/s

    UNITS "Centidegrees" cdeg

  # MAVLink 2 Extension Fields
  APPEND_ITEM ID 8 UINT "GPS ID (zero indexed). Used for multiple GPS inputs"
  APPEND_ITEM YAW 16 UINT "Yaw of vehicle relative to Earth's North, zero means not available, use 36000..."
    UNITS "Centidegrees" cdeg
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

  APPEND_ITEM INTEGRATED_Y 32 FLOAT "Flow in radians around Y axis (Sensor RH rotation about the Y axis induces a ..."
    UNITS "Radians" rad
  APPEND_ITEM INTEGRATED_XGYRO 32 FLOAT "RH rotation around X axis"
    UNITS "Radians" rad
  APPEND_ITEM INTEGRATED_YGYRO 32 FLOAT "RH rotation around Y axis"
    UNITS "Radians" rad
  APPEND_ITEM INTEGRATED_ZGYRO 32 FLOAT "RH rotation around Z axis"
    UNITS "Radians" rad
  APPEND_ITEM TEMPERATURE 16 INT "Temperature"
    UNITS "Centidegrees_Celsius" cdegC
  APPEND_ITEM QUALITY 8 UINT "Optical flow quality / confidence. 0: no valid flow, 255: maximum quality"
  APPEND_ITEM TIME_DELTA_DISTANCE_US 32 UINT "Time since the distance was sampled."
    UNITS "Microseconds" us
  APPEND_ITEM DISTANCE 32 FLOAT "Distance to the center of the flow field. Positive value (including zero): di..."
    UNITS "Meters" m
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# HIL_STATE_QUATERNION (ID 115)
# Sent from simulation to autopilot, avoids in contrast to HIL_STATE
# singularities. This packet is useful for high throughput applications such
# as hardware in the loop simulations.

  APPEND_ARRAY_ITEM ATTITUDE_QUATERNION 32 FLOAT 128 "Vehicle attitude expressed as normalized quaternion in w, x, y, z order (with..."

    UNITS "Radians_per_second" rad/s

    UNITS "Radians_per_second" rad/s

  APPEND_ITEM LON 32 INT "Longitude"
    UNITS "Degrees_E7" degE7

    UNITS "Millimeters" mm

  APPEND_ITEM VY 16 INT "Ground Y Speed (Longitude)"
    UNITS "Centimeters_per_second" cm/s
  APPEND_ITEM VZ 16 INT "Ground Z Speed (Altitude)"
    UNITS "Centimeters_per_second" cm/s

    UNITS "Centimeters_per_second" cm/s
  APPEND_ITEM TRUE_AIRSPEED 16 UINT "True airspeed"
    UNITS "Centimeters_per_second" cm/s

    UNITS "Millig" mG

# ============================================================================
# LOG_REQUEST_LIST (ID 117)
# Request a list of available logs. On some systems calling this may stop
# on-board logging until LOG_REQUEST_END is called. If there are no log
# files available this request shall be answered with one LOG_ENTRY message
# with id = 0 and num_logs = 0.
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> LOG_REQUEST_LIST LITTLE_ENDIAN "Request a list of available logs. On some systems calling this may stop on-board logging until LO..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 117} %>
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_SYSTEM 8 UINT "System ID"
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_COMPONENT 8 UINT "Component ID"
  APPEND_ITEM START 16 UINT "First log id (0 for first available)"
  APPEND_ITEM END 16 UINT "Last log id (0xffff for last available)"
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

    UNITS "Seconds" s
  APPEND_ITEM SIZE 32 UINT "Size of the log (may be approximate)"
    UNITS "Bytes" B
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# SERIAL_CONTROL (ID 126)
# Control a serial port. This can be used for raw access to an onboard
# serial peripheral such as a GPS or telemetry radio. It is designed to make
# it possible to update the devices firmware via MAVLink messages or change
# the devices settings. A message with zero bytes can be used to change just
# the baudrate.
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> SERIAL_CONTROL LITTLE_ENDIAN "Control a serial port. This can be used for raw access to an onboard serial peripheral such as a ..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 126} %>
  APPEND_ITEM DEVICE 8 UINT "Serial control device type."
    STATE SERIAL_CONTROL_DEV_TELEM1 0
    STATE SERIAL_CONTROL_DEV_TELEM2 1
    STATE SERIAL_CONTROL_DEV_GPS1 2
    STATE SERIAL_CONTROL_DEV_GPS2 3
    STATE SERIAL_CONTROL_DEV_SHELL 10
    STATE SERIAL_CONTROL_SERIAL0 100
    STATE SERIAL_CONTROL_SERIAL1 101
    STATE SERIAL_CONTROL_SERIAL2 102
    STATE SERIAL_CONTROL_SERIAL3 103
    STATE SERIAL_CONTROL_SERIAL4 104
    STATE SERIAL_CONTROL_SERIAL5 105
    STATE SERIAL_CONTROL_SERIAL6 106
    STATE SERIAL_CONTROL_SERIAL7 107
    STATE SERIAL_CONTROL_SERIAL8 108
    STATE SERIAL_CONTROL_SERIAL9 109
  APPEND_ITEM FLAGS 8 UINT "Bitmap of serial control flags."
  APPEND_ITEM TIMEOUT 16 UINT "Timeout for reply data"
    UNITS "Milliseconds" ms
  APPEND_ITEM BAUDRATE 32 UINT "Baudrate of transfer. Zero means no change."
    UNITS "bits_per_s" bits/s
  APPEND_ITEM COUNT 8 UINT "how many bytes in this transfer"
    UNITS "Bytes" B
  APPEND_ARRAY_ITEM DATA 8 UINT 560 "serial data"
  # MAVLink 2 Extension Fields
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_SYSTEM 8 UINT "System ID"
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_COMPONENT 8 UINT "Component ID"
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

    UNITS "Hertz" Hz

    STATE RTK_BASELINE_COORDINATE_SYSTEM_NED 1

    UNITS "Millimeters" mm

  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

    UNITS "Bytes" B

  APPEND_ITEM HEIGHT 16 UINT "Height of a matrix or image."

  APPEND_ITEM PAYLOAD 8 UINT "Payload size per packet (normally 253 byte, see DATA field size in message EN..."

    UNITS "Percent" %

    STATE MAV_DISTANCE_SENSOR_ULTRASOUND 1

    STATE MAV_DISTANCE_SENSOR_UNKNOWN 4

  APPEND_ITEM ORIENTATION 8 UINT "Direction the sensor faces. downward-facing: ROTATION_PITCH_270, upward-facin..."
  APPEND_ITEM COVARIANCE 8 UINT "Measurement variance. Max standard deviation is 6cm. UINT8_MAX if unknown."
    UNITS "cm^2" cm^2

    UNITS "Radians" rad

    UNITS "Radians" rad
  APPEND_ARRAY_ITEM QUATERNION 32 FLOAT 128 "Quaternion of the sensor orientation in vehicle body frame (w, x, y, z order,..."
  APPEND_ITEM SIGNAL_QUALITY 8 UINT "Signal quality of the sensor. Specific to each sensor type, representing the ..."
    UNITS "Percent" %
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

    FORMAT_STRING "0x%07x"

    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# TERRAIN_DATA (ID 134)
# Terrain data sent from GCS. The lat/lon and grid_spacing must be the same
# as a lat/lon from a TERRAIN_REQUEST. See terrain protocol docs:
# https://mavlink.io/en/services/terrain.html
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> TERRAIN_DATA LITTLE_ENDIAN "Terrain data sent from GCS. The lat/lon and grid_spacing must be the same as a lat/lon from a TER..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 134} %>
  APPEND_ITEM LAT 32 INT "Latitude of SW corner of first grid"
    UNITS "Degrees_E7" degE7
  APPEND_ITEM LON 32 INT "Longitude of SW corner of first grid"
    UNITS "Degrees_E7" degE7
  APPEND_ITEM GRID_SPACING 16 UINT "Grid spacing"
    UNITS "Meters" m
  APPEND_ITEM GRIDBIT 8 UINT "bit within the terrain request mask"
  APPEND_ARRAY_ITEM DATA 16 INT 256 "Terrain data MSL"
    UNITS "Meters" m
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# TERRAIN_CHECK (ID 135)
# Request that the vehicle report terrain height at the given location
# (expected response is a TERRAIN_REPORT). Used by GCS to check if vehicle
# has all terrain data needed for a mission.
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> TERRAIN_CHECK LITTLE_ENDIAN "Request that the vehicle report terrain height at the given location (expected response is a TERR..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 135} %>
  APPEND_ITEM LAT 32 INT "Latitude"
    UNITS "Degrees_E7" degE7
  APPEND_ITEM LON 32 INT "Longitude"
    UNITS "Degrees_E7" degE7
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# TERRAIN_REPORT (ID 136)
# Streamed from drone to report progress of terrain map download (initiated
# by TERRAIN_REQUEST), or sent as a response to a TERRAIN_CHECK request. See
# terrain protocol docs: https://mavlink.io/en/services/terrain.html
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> TERRAIN_REPORT LITTLE_ENDIAN "Streamed from drone to report progress of terrain map download (initiated by TERRAIN_REQUEST), or..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 136} %>
  APPEND_ITEM LAT 32 INT "Latitude"
    UNITS "Degrees_E7" degE7
  APPEND_ITEM LON 32 INT "Longitude"
    UNITS "Degrees_E7" degE7
  APPEND_ITEM SPACING 16 UINT "grid spacing (zero if terrain at this location unavailable)"
  APPEND_ITEM TERRAIN_HEIGHT 32 FLOAT "Terrain height MSL"
    UNITS "Meters" m
  APPEND_ITEM CURRENT_HEIGHT 32 FLOAT "Current vehicle height above lat/lon terrain height"
    UNITS "Meters" m
  APPEND_ITEM PENDING 16 UINT "Number of 4x4 terrain blocks waiting to be received or read from disk"
  APPEND_ITEM LOADED 16 UINT "Number of 4x4 terrain blocks in memory"
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# BATTERY_STATUS (ID 147)
# Battery information. Updates GCS with flight controller battery status.
# Smart batteries also use this message, but may additionally send
# BATTERY_INFO.
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> BATTERY_STATUS LITTLE_ENDIAN "Battery information. Updates GCS with flight controller battery status. Smart batteries also use ..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 147} %>
  APPEND_ITEM ID 8 UINT "Battery ID"
  APPEND_ITEM BATTERY_FUNCTION 8 UINT "Function of the battery"
    STATE MAV_BATTERY_FUNCTION_UNKNOWN 0
    STATE MAV_BATTERY_FUNCTION_ALL 1
    STATE MAV_BATTERY_FUNCTION_PROPULSION 2
    STATE MAV_BATTERY_FUNCTION_AVIONICS 3
    STATE MAV_BATTERY_FUNCTION_PAYLOAD 4
  APPEND_ITEM TYPE 8 UINT "Type (chemistry) of the battery"
    STATE MAV_BATTERY_TYPE_UNKNOWN 0
    STATE MAV_BATTERY_TYPE_LIPO 1
    STATE MAV_BATTERY_TYPE_LIFE 2
    STATE MAV_BATTERY_TYPE_LION 3
    STATE MAV_BATTERY_TYPE_NIMH 4
  APPEND_ITEM TEMPERATURE 16 INT "Temperature of the battery. INT16_MAX for unknown temperature."
    UNITS "Centidegrees_Celsius" cdegC
  APPEND_ARRAY_ITEM VOLTAGES 16 UINT 160 "Battery voltage of cells 1 to 10 (see voltages_ext for cells 11-14). Cells in..."
    UNITS "Millivolts" mV
  APPEND_ITEM CURRENT_BATTERY 16 INT "Battery current, -1: autopilot does not measure the current"
    UNITS "Centiamps" cA
  APPEND_ITEM CURRENT_CONSUMED 32 INT "Consumed charge, -1: autopilot does not provide consumption estimate"
    UNITS "Milliamp_hours" mAh
  APPEND_ITEM ENERGY_CONSUMED 32 INT "Consumed energy, -1: autopilot does not provide energy consumption estimate"
    UNITS "Hectojoules" hJ
  APPEND_ITEM BATTERY_REMAINING 8 INT "Remaining battery energy. Values: [0-100], -1: autopilot does not estimate th..."
    UNITS "Percent" %
  # MAVLink 2 Extension Fields
  APPEND_ITEM TIME_REMAINING 32 INT "Remaining battery time, 0: autopilot does not provide remaining battery time ..."
    UNITS "Seconds" s
  APPEND_ITEM CHARGE_STATE 8 UINT "State for extent of discharge, provided by autopilot for warning or external ..."
    STATE MAV_BATTERY_CHARGE_STATE_UNDEFINED 0
    STATE MAV_BATTERY_CHARGE_STATE_OK 1
    STATE MAV_BATTERY_CHARGE_STATE_LOW 2
    STATE MAV_BATTERY_CHARGE_STATE_CRITICAL 3
    STATE MAV_BATTERY_CHARGE_STATE_EMERGENCY 4
    STATE MAV_BATTERY_CHARGE_STATE_FAILED 5
    STATE MAV_BATTERY_CHARGE_STATE_UNHEALTHY 6
    STATE MAV_BATTERY_CHARGE_STATE_CHARGING 7
  APPEND_ARRAY_ITEM VOLTAGES_EXT 16 UINT 64 "Battery voltages for cells 11 to 14. Cells above the valid cell count for thi..."
    UNITS "Millivolts" mV
  APPEND_ITEM MODE 8 UINT "Battery mode. Default (0) is that battery mode reporting is not supported or ..."
    STATE MAV_BATTERY_MODE_UNKNOWN 0
    STATE MAV_BATTERY_MODE_AUTO_DISCHARGING 1
    STATE MAV_BATTERY_MODE_HOT_SWAP 2
  APPEND_ITEM FAULT_BITMASK 32 UINT "Fault/health indications. These should be set when charge_state is MAV_BATTER..."
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

    STATE LANDING_TARGET_TYPE_VISION_FIDUCIAL 2
    STATE LANDING_TARGET_TYPE_VISION_OTHER 3

  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# Status of geo-fencing. Sent in extended status stream when fencing
# enabled.
# ============================================================================

  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 162} %>
  APPEND_ITEM BREACH_STATUS 8 UINT "Breach status (0 if currently inside fence, 1 if outside)."
  APPEND_ITEM BREACH_COUNT 16 UINT "Number of fence breaches."
  APPEND_ITEM BREACH_TYPE 8 UINT "Last breach type."
    STATE FENCE_BREACH_NONE 0
    STATE FENCE_BREACH_MINALT 1
    STATE FENCE_BREACH_MAXALT 2
    STATE FENCE_BREACH_BOUNDARY 3
  APPEND_ITEM BREACH_TIME 32 UINT "Time (since boot) of last breach."
    UNITS "Milliseconds" ms
  # MAVLink 2 Extension Fields
  APPEND_ITEM BREACH_MITIGATION 8 UINT "Active action to prevent fence breach"
    STATE FENCE_MITIGATE_UNKNOWN 0
    STATE FENCE_MITIGATE_NONE 1
    STATE FENCE_MITIGATE_VEL_LIMIT 2
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# MAG_CAL_REPORT (ID 192)
# Reports results of completed compass calibration. Sent until MAG_CAL_ACK
# received.
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> MAG_CAL_REPORT LITTLE_ENDIAN "Reports results of completed compass calibration. Sent until MAG_CAL_ACK received."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 192} %>
  APPEND_ITEM COMPASS_ID 8 UINT "Compass being calibrated."
  APPEND_ITEM CAL_MASK 8 UINT "Bitmask of compasses being calibrated."
  APPEND_ITEM CAL_STATUS 8 UINT "Calibration Status."
    STATE MAG_CAL_NOT_STARTED 0
    STATE MAG_CAL_WAITING_TO_START 1
    STATE MAG_CAL_RUNNING_STEP_ONE 2
    STATE MAG_CAL_RUNNING_STEP_TWO 3
    STATE MAG_CAL_SUCCESS 4
    STATE MAG_CAL_FAILED 5
    STATE MAG_CAL_BAD_ORIENTATION 6
    STATE MAG_CAL_BAD_RADIUS 7
  APPEND_ITEM AUTOSAVED 8 UINT "0=requires a MAV_CMD_DO_ACCEPT_MAG_CAL, 1=saved to parameters."
  APPEND_ITEM FITNESS 32 FLOAT "RMS milligauss residuals."
    UNITS "Milligauss" mgauss
  APPEND_ITEM OFS_X 32 FLOAT "X offset."
  APPEND_ITEM OFS_Y 32 FLOAT "Y offset."
  APPEND_ITEM OFS_Z 32 FLOAT "Z offset."
  APPEND_ITEM DIAG_X 32 FLOAT "X diagonal (matrix 11)."
  APPEND_ITEM DIAG_Y 32 FLOAT "Y diagonal (matrix 22)."
  APPEND_ITEM DIAG_Z 32 FLOAT "Z diagonal (matrix 33)."
  APPEND_ITEM OFFDIAG_X 32 FLOAT "X off-diagonal (matrix 12 and 21)."
  APPEND_ITEM OFFDIAG_Y 32 FLOAT "Y off-diagonal (matrix 13 and 31)."
  APPEND_ITEM OFFDIAG_Z 32 FLOAT "Z off-diagonal (matrix 32 and 23)."
  # MAVLink 2 Extension Fields
  APPEND_ITEM ORIENTATION_CONFIDENCE 32 FLOAT "Confidence in orientation (higher is better)."
  APPEND_ITEM OLD_ORIENTATION 8 UINT "orientation before calibration."
  APPEND_ITEM NEW_ORIENTATION 8 UINT "orientation after calibration."
  APPEND_ITEM SCALE_FACTOR 32 FLOAT "field radius correction factor"
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

  APPEND_ITEM RPM 32 FLOAT "RPM"

    UNITS "cm^3" cm^3
  APPEND_ITEM FUEL_FLOW 32 FLOAT "Fuel flow rate"
    UNITS "cm^3_per_min" cm^3/min
  APPEND_ITEM ENGINE_LOAD 32 FLOAT "Engine load"
    UNITS "Percent" %
  APPEND_ITEM THROTTLE_POSITION 32 FLOAT "Throttle position"
    UNITS "Percent" %
  APPEND_ITEM SPARK_DWELL_TIME 32 FLOAT "Spark dwell time"
    UNITS "Milliseconds" ms
  APPEND_ITEM BAROMETRIC_PRESSURE 32 FLOAT "Barometric pressure"
    UNITS "kPa" kPa
  APPEND_ITEM INTAKE_MANIFOLD_PRESSURE 32 FLOAT "Intake manifold pressure("
    UNITS "kPa" kPa
  APPEND_ITEM INTAKE_MANIFOLD_TEMPERATURE 32 FLOAT "Intake manifold temperature"
    UNITS "Celsius" degC
  APPEND_ITEM CYLINDER_HEAD_TEMPERATURE 32 FLOAT "Cylinder head temperature"
    UNITS "Celsius" degC
  APPEND_ITEM IGNITION_TIMING 32 FLOAT "Ignition timing (Crank angle degrees)"
    UNITS "Degrees" deg
  APPEND_ITEM INJECTION_TIME 32 FLOAT "Injection time"
    UNITS "Milliseconds" ms
  APPEND_ITEM EXHAUST_GAS_TEMPERATURE 32 FLOAT "Exhaust gas temperature"
    UNITS "Celsius" degC
  APPEND_ITEM THROTTLE_OUT 32 FLOAT "Output throttle"
    UNITS "Percent" %
  APPEND_ITEM PT_COMPENSATION 32 FLOAT "Pressure/temperature compensation"
  # MAVLink 2 Extension Fields
  APPEND_ITEM IGNITION_VOLTAGE 32 FLOAT "Supply voltage to EFI sparking system. Zero in this value means 'unknown', so..."
    UNITS "V" V
  APPEND_ITEM FUEL_PRESSURE 32 FLOAT "Fuel pressure. Zero in this value means 'unknown', so if the fuel pressure re..."
    UNITS "kPa" kPa
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# ESTIMATOR_STATUS (ID 230)
# Estimator status message including flags, innovation test ratios and
# estimated accuracies. The flags message is an integer bitmask containing
# information on which EKF outputs are valid. See the ESTIMATOR_STATUS_FLAGS
# enum definition for further information. The innovation test ratios show
# the magnitude of the sensor innovation divided by the innovation check
# threshold. Under normal operation the innovation test ratios should be
# below 0.5 with occasional values up to 1.0. Values greater than 1.0 should
# be rare under normal operation and indicate that a measurement has been
# rejected by the filter. The user should be notified if an innovation test
# ratio greater than 1.0 is recorded. Notifications for values in the range
# between 0.5 and 1.0 should be optional and controllable by the user.
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> ESTIMATOR_STATUS LITTLE_ENDIAN "Estimator status message including flags, innovation test ratios and estimated accuracies. The fl..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 230} %>
  APPEND_ITEM TIME_USEC 64 UINT "Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can ..."
    UNITS "Microseconds" us
  APPEND_ITEM FLAGS 16 UINT "Bitmap indicating which EKF outputs are valid."
  APPEND_ITEM VEL_RATIO 32 FLOAT "Velocity innovation test ratio"
  APPEND_ITEM POS_HORIZ_RATIO 32 FLOAT "Horizontal position innovation test ratio"
  APPEND_ITEM POS_VERT_RATIO 32 FLOAT "Vertical position innovation test ratio"
  APPEND_ITEM MAG_RATIO 32 FLOAT "Magnetometer innovation test ratio"
  APPEND_ITEM HAGL_RATIO 32 FLOAT "Height above terrain innovation test ratio"
  APPEND_ITEM TAS_RATIO 32 FLOAT "True airspeed innovation test ratio"
  APPEND_ITEM POS_HORIZ_ACCURACY 32 FLOAT "Horizontal position 1-STD accuracy relative to the EKF local origin"
    UNITS "Meters" m
  APPEND_ITEM POS_VERT_ACCURACY 32 FLOAT "Vertical position 1-STD accuracy relative to the EKF local origin"
    UNITS "Meters" m
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

    UNITS "Meters_per_second" m/s
  APPEND_ITEM WIND_Z 32 FLOAT "Wind in down (NED) direction (NAN if unknown)"
    UNITS "Meters_per_second" m/s
  APPEND_ITEM VAR_HORIZ 32 FLOAT "Variability of wind in XY, 1-STD estimated from a 1 Hz lowpassed wind estimat..."
    UNITS "Meters_per_second" m/s
  APPEND_ITEM VAR_VERT 32 FLOAT "Variability of wind in Z, 1-STD estimated from a 1 Hz lowpassed wind estimate..."
    UNITS "Meters_per_second" m/s
  APPEND_ITEM WIND_ALT 32 FLOAT "Altitude (MSL) that this measurement was taken at (NAN if unknown)"
    UNITS "Meters" m
  APPEND_ITEM HORIZ_ACCURACY 32 FLOAT "Horizontal speed 1-STD accuracy (0 if unknown)"
    UNITS "Meters_per_second" m/s
  APPEND_ITEM VERT_ACCURACY 32 FLOAT "Vertical speed 1-STD accuracy (0 if unknown)"
    UNITS "Meters_per_second" m/s
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# HOME_POSITION (ID 242)
# Contains the home position. The home position is the default position that
# the system will return to and land on. The position must be set
# automatically by the system during the takeoff, and may also be explicitly
# set using MAV_CMD_DO_SET_HOME. The global and local positions encode the
# position in the respective coordinate frames, while the q parameter
# encodes the orientation of the surface. Under normal conditions it
# describes the heading and terrain slope, which can be used by the aircraft
# to adjust the approach. The approach 3D vector describes the point to
# which the system should fly in normal flight mode and then perform a
# landing sequence along the vector. Note: this message can be requested by
# sending the MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE with param1=242 (or the deprecated
# MAV_CMD_GET_HOME_POSITION command).
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> HOME_POSITION LITTLE_ENDIAN "Contains the home position. The home position is the default position that the system will return..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 242} %>
  APPEND_ITEM LATITUDE 32 INT "Latitude (WGS84)"
    UNITS "Degrees_E7" degE7
  APPEND_ITEM LONGITUDE 32 INT "Longitude (WGS84)"
    UNITS "Degrees_E7" degE7
  APPEND_ITEM ALTITUDE 32 INT "Altitude (MSL). Positive for up."
    UNITS "Millimeters" mm
  APPEND_ITEM X 32 FLOAT "Local X position of this position in the local coordinate frame (NED)"
    UNITS "Meters" m
  APPEND_ITEM Y 32 FLOAT "Local Y position of this position in the local coordinate frame (NED)"
    UNITS "Meters" m
  APPEND_ITEM Z 32 FLOAT "Local Z position of this position in the local coordinate frame (NED: positiv..."
    UNITS "Meters" m
  APPEND_ARRAY_ITEM Q 32 FLOAT 128 "Quaternion indicating world-to-surface-normal and heading transformation of t..."
  APPEND_ITEM APPROACH_X 32 FLOAT "Local X position of the end of the approach vector. Multicopters should set t..."
    UNITS "Meters" m
  APPEND_ITEM APPROACH_Y 32 FLOAT "Local Y position of the end of the approach vector. Multicopters should set t..."
    UNITS "Meters" m
  APPEND_ITEM APPROACH_Z 32 FLOAT "Local Z position of the end of the approach vector. Multicopters should set t..."
    UNITS "Meters" m
  # MAVLink 2 Extension Fields
  APPEND_ITEM TIME_USEC 64 UINT "Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can ..."
    UNITS "Microseconds" us
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# SET_HOME_POSITION (ID 243)
# Sets the home position. The home position is the default position that the
# system will return to and land on. The position is set automatically by
# the system during the takeoff (and may also be set using this message).
# The global and local positions encode the position in the respective
# coordinate frames, while the q parameter encodes the orientation of the
# surface. Under normal conditions it describes the heading and terrain
# slope, which can be used by the aircraft to adjust the approach. The
# approach 3D vector describes the point to which the system should fly in
# normal flight mode and then perform a landing sequence along the vector.
# Note: the current home position may be emitted in a HOME_POSITION message
# on request (using MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE with param1=242).
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> SET_HOME_POSITION LITTLE_ENDIAN "Sets the home position. The home position is the default position that the system will return to ..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 243} %>
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_SYSTEM 8 UINT "System ID."
  APPEND_ITEM LATITUDE 32 INT "Latitude (WGS84)"
    UNITS "Degrees_E7" degE7
  APPEND_ITEM LONGITUDE 32 INT "Longitude (WGS84)"
    UNITS "Degrees_E7" degE7
  APPEND_ITEM ALTITUDE 32 INT "Altitude (MSL). Positive for up."
    UNITS "Millimeters" mm
  APPEND_ITEM X 32 FLOAT "Local X position of this position in the local coordinate frame (NED)"
    UNITS "Meters" m
  APPEND_ITEM Y 32 FLOAT "Local Y position of this position in the local coordinate frame (NED)"
    UNITS "Meters" m
  APPEND_ITEM Z 32 FLOAT "Local Z position of this position in the local coordinate frame (NED: positiv..."
    UNITS "Meters" m
  APPEND_ARRAY_ITEM Q 32 FLOAT 128 "World to surface normal and heading transformation of the takeoff position. U..."
  APPEND_ITEM APPROACH_X 32 FLOAT "Local X position of the end of the approach vector. Multicopters should set t..."
    UNITS "Meters" m
  APPEND_ITEM APPROACH_Y 32 FLOAT "Local Y position of the end of the approach vector. Multicopters should set t..."
    UNITS "Meters" m
  APPEND_ITEM APPROACH_Z 32 FLOAT "Local Z position of the end of the approach vector. Multicopters should set t..."
    UNITS "Meters" m
  # MAVLink 2 Extension Fields
  APPEND_ITEM TIME_USEC 64 UINT "Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can ..."
    UNITS "Microseconds" us
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# MESSAGE_INTERVAL (ID 244)

  APPEND_ITEM INTERVAL_US 32 INT "The interval between two messages. A value of -1 indicates this stream is dis..."
    UNITS "Microseconds" us
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

    STATE ADSB_EMITTER_TYPE_UAV 14

    UNITS "Seconds" s
  APPEND_ITEM FLAGS 16 UINT "Bitmap to indicate various statuses including valid data fields"
  APPEND_ITEM SQUAWK 16 UINT "Squawk code. Note that the code is in decimal: e.g. 7700 (general emergency) ..."
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# COLLISION (ID 247)
# Information about a potential collision
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> COLLISION LITTLE_ENDIAN "Information about a potential collision"
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 247} %>
  APPEND_ITEM SRC 8 UINT "Collision data source"
    STATE MAV_COLLISION_SRC_ADSB 0
    STATE MAV_COLLISION_SRC_MAVLINK_GPS_GLOBAL_INT 1
  APPEND_ITEM ID 32 UINT "Unique identifier, domain based on src field"
  APPEND_ITEM ACTION 8 UINT "Action that is being taken to avoid this collision"
    STATE MAV_COLLISION_ACTION_NONE 0
    STATE MAV_COLLISION_ACTION_REPORT 1
    STATE MAV_COLLISION_ACTION_ASCEND_OR_DESCEND 2
    STATE MAV_COLLISION_ACTION_MOVE_HORIZONTALLY 3
    STATE MAV_COLLISION_ACTION_MOVE_PERPENDICULAR 4
    STATE MAV_COLLISION_ACTION_RTL 5
    STATE MAV_COLLISION_ACTION_HOVER 6
  APPEND_ITEM THREAT_LEVEL 8 UINT "How concerned the aircraft is about this collision"
    STATE MAV_COLLISION_THREAT_LEVEL_NONE 0
    STATE MAV_COLLISION_THREAT_LEVEL_LOW 1
    STATE MAV_COLLISION_THREAT_LEVEL_HIGH 2
  APPEND_ITEM TIME_TO_MINIMUM_DELTA 32 FLOAT "Estimated time until collision occurs"
    UNITS "Seconds" s
  APPEND_ITEM ALTITUDE_MINIMUM_DELTA 32 FLOAT "Closest vertical distance between vehicle and object"
    UNITS "Meters" m
  APPEND_ITEM HORIZONTAL_MINIMUM_DELTA 32 FLOAT "Closest horizontal distance between vehicle and object"
    UNITS "Meters" m
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

  APPEND_ARRAY_ITEM PAYLOAD 8 UINT 1992 "Variable length payload. The length must be encoded in the payload as part of..."

    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# STATUSTEXT (ID 253)
# Status text message. These messages are printed in yellow in the COMM
# console of QGroundControl. WARNING: They consume quite some bandwidth, so
# use only for important status and error messages. If implemented wisely,
# these messages are buffered on the MCU and sent only at a limited rate
# (e.g. 10 Hz).
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> STATUSTEXT LITTLE_ENDIAN "Status text message. These messages are printed in yellow in the COMM console of QGroundControl. ..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 253} %>
  APPEND_ITEM SEVERITY 8 UINT "Severity of status. Relies on the definitions within RFC-5424."
    STATE MAV_SEVERITY_EMERGENCY 0
    STATE MAV_SEVERITY_ALERT 1
    STATE MAV_SEVERITY_CRITICAL 2
    STATE MAV_SEVERITY_ERROR 3
    STATE MAV_SEVERITY_WARNING 4
    STATE MAV_SEVERITY_NOTICE 5
    STATE MAV_SEVERITY_INFO 6
    STATE MAV_SEVERITY_DEBUG 7
  APPEND_ITEM TEXT 400 STRING "Status text message, without null termination character. UTF-8 encoded."
  # MAVLink 2 Extension Fields
  APPEND_ITEM ID 16 UINT "Unique (opaque) identifier for this statustext message. May be used to reasse..."
  APPEND_ITEM CHUNK_SEQ 8 UINT "This chunk's sequence number; indexing is from zero. Any null character in th..."
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================

    STATE STORAGE_STATUS_UNFORMATTED 1
    STATE STORAGE_STATUS_READY 2
    STATE STORAGE_STATUS_NOT_SUPPORTED 3

    UNITS "MiB" MiB
  APPEND_ITEM USED_CAPACITY 32 FLOAT "Used capacity. If storage is not ready (STORAGE_STATUS_READY) value will be i..."
    UNITS "MiB" MiB
  APPEND_ITEM AVAILABLE_CAPACITY 32 FLOAT "Available storage capacity. If storage is not ready (STORAGE_STATUS_READY) va..."
    UNITS "MiB" MiB
  APPEND_ITEM READ_SPEED 32 FLOAT "Read speed."
    UNITS "MiB_per_s" MiB/s
  APPEND_ITEM WRITE_SPEED 32 FLOAT "Write speed."
    UNITS "MiB_per_s" MiB/s
  # MAVLink 2 Extension Fields
  APPEND_ITEM TYPE 8 UINT "Type of storage"
    STATE STORAGE_TYPE_UNKNOWN 0
    STATE STORAGE_TYPE_USB_STICK 1
    STATE STORAGE_TYPE_SD 2
    STATE STORAGE_TYPE_MICROSD 3
    STATE STORAGE_TYPE_CF 4
    STATE STORAGE_TYPE_CFE 5
    STATE STORAGE_TYPE_XQD 6
    STATE STORAGE_TYPE_HD 7
    STATE STORAGE_TYPE_OTHER 254
  APPEND_ITEM NAME 256 STRING "Textual storage name to be used in UI (microSD 1, Internal Memory, etc.) This..."
  APPEND_ITEM STORAGE_USAGE 8 UINT "Flags indicating whether this instance is preferred storage for photos, video..."
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# CAMERA_IMAGE_CAPTURED (ID 263)
# Information about a captured image. This is emitted every time a message
# is captured. MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE can be used to (re)request this
# message for a specific sequence number or range of sequence numbers:
# MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE.param2 indicates the sequence number the first
# image to send, or set to -1 to send the message for all sequence numbers.
# MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE.param3 is used to specify a range of messages to
# send: set to 0 (default) to send just the the message for the sequence
# number in param 2, set to -1 to send the message for the sequence number
# in param 2 and all the following sequence numbers, set to the sequence
# number of the final message in the range.
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> CAMERA_IMAGE_CAPTURED LITTLE_ENDIAN "Information about a captured image. This is emitted every time a message is captured. MAV_CMD_REQ..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 263} %>
  APPEND_ITEM TIME_BOOT_MS 32 UINT "Timestamp (time since system boot)."
    UNITS "Milliseconds" ms
  APPEND_ITEM TIME_UTC 64 UINT "Timestamp (time since UNIX epoch) in UTC. 0 for unknown."
    UNITS "Microseconds" us
  APPEND_ITEM CAMERA_ID 8 UINT "Camera id of a non-MAVLink camera attached to an autopilot (1-6). 0 if the co..."
  APPEND_ITEM LAT 32 INT "Latitude where image was taken"
    UNITS "Degrees_E7" degE7
  APPEND_ITEM LON 32 INT "Longitude where capture was taken"
    UNITS "Degrees_E7" degE7
  APPEND_ITEM ALT 32 INT "Altitude (MSL) where image was taken"
    UNITS "Millimeters" mm
  APPEND_ITEM RELATIVE_ALT 32 INT "Altitude above ground"
    UNITS "Millimeters" mm
  APPEND_ARRAY_ITEM Q 32 FLOAT 128 "Quaternion of camera orientation (w, x, y, z order, zero-rotation is 1, 0, 0, 0)"
  APPEND_ITEM IMAGE_INDEX 32 INT "Zero based index of this image (i.e. a new image will have index CAMERA_CAPTU..."
  APPEND_ITEM CAPTURE_RESULT 8 INT "Image was captured successfully (MAV_BOOL_TRUE). Values not equal to 0 or 1 a..."
  APPEND_ITEM FILE_URL 1640 STRING "URL of image taken. Either local storage or http://foo.jpg if camera provides..."
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# FLIGHT_INFORMATION (ID 264)
# Flight information. This includes time since boot for arm, takeoff, and
# land, and a flight number. Takeoff and landing values reset to zero on
# arm. This can be requested using MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE. Note, some
# fields are misnamed - timestamps are from boot (not UTC) and the
# flight_uuid is a sequence number.
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> FLIGHT_INFORMATION LITTLE_ENDIAN "Flight information. This includes time since boot for arm, takeoff, and land, and a flight number..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 264} %>
  APPEND_ITEM TIME_BOOT_MS 32 UINT "Timestamp (time since system boot)."
    UNITS "Milliseconds" ms
  APPEND_ITEM ARMING_TIME_UTC 64 UINT "Timestamp at arming (since system boot). Set to 0 on boot. Set value on armin..."
    UNITS "Microseconds" us
  APPEND_ITEM TAKEOFF_TIME_UTC 64 UINT "Timestamp at takeoff (since system boot). Set to 0 at boot and on arming. Not..."
    UNITS "Microseconds" us
  APPEND_ITEM FLIGHT_UUID 64 UINT "Flight number. Note, field is misnamed UUID."
  # MAVLink 2 Extension Fields
  APPEND_ITEM LANDING_TIME 32 UINT "Timestamp at landing (in ms since system boot). Set to 0 at boot and on arming."
    UNITS "Milliseconds" ms
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

    UNITS "Hertz" Hz
  APPEND_ITEM RESOLUTION_H 16 UINT "Horizontal resolution."
    UNITS "pix" pix
  APPEND_ITEM RESOLUTION_V 16 UINT "Vertical resolution."
    UNITS "pix" pix

    UNITS "bits_per_s" bits/s

    UNITS "Degrees" deg

    UNITS "Degrees" deg

    STATE VIDEO_STREAM_ENCODING_UNKNOWN 0
    STATE VIDEO_STREAM_ENCODING_H264 1
    STATE VIDEO_STREAM_ENCODING_H265 2
  APPEND_ITEM CAMERA_DEVICE_ID 8 UINT "Camera id of a non-MAVLink camera attached to an autopilot (1-6). 0 if the co..."
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# GIMBAL_DEVICE_SET_ATTITUDE (ID 284)
# Low level message to control a gimbal device's attitude. This message is
# to be sent from the gimbal manager to the gimbal device component. The
# quaternion and angular velocities can be set to NaN according to use case.
# For the angles encoded in the quaternion and the angular velocities holds:
# If the flag GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_IN_VEHICLE_FRAME is set, then they are
# relative to the vehicle heading (vehicle frame). If the flag
# GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_IN_EARTH_FRAME is set, then they are relative to
# absolute North (earth frame). If neither of these flags are set, then (for
# backwards compatibility) it holds: If the flag
# GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_LOCK is set, then they are relative to absolute
# North (earth frame), else they are relative to the vehicle heading
# (vehicle frame). Setting both GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_IN_VEHICLE_FRAME and
# GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_IN_EARTH_FRAME is not allowed. These rules are to
# ensure backwards compatibility. New implementations should always set
# either GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_IN_VEHICLE_FRAME or
# GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_IN_EARTH_FRAME.
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> GIMBAL_DEVICE_SET_ATTITUDE LITTLE_ENDIAN "Low level message to control a gimbal device's attitude. This message is to be sent from the gimb..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 284} %>
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_SYSTEM 8 UINT "System ID"
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_COMPONENT 8 UINT "Component ID"
  APPEND_ITEM FLAGS 16 UINT "Low level gimbal flags."
  APPEND_ARRAY_ITEM Q 32 FLOAT 128 "Quaternion components, w, x, y, z (1 0 0 0 is the null-rotation). The frame i..."
  APPEND_ITEM ANGULAR_VELOCITY_X 32 FLOAT "X component of angular velocity (positive: rolling to the right). The frame i..."
    UNITS "Radians_per_second" rad/s
  APPEND_ITEM ANGULAR_VELOCITY_Y 32 FLOAT "Y component of angular velocity (positive: pitching up). The frame is describ..."
    UNITS "Radians_per_second" rad/s
  APPEND_ITEM ANGULAR_VELOCITY_Z 32 FLOAT "Z component of angular velocity (positive: yawing to the right). The frame is..."
    UNITS "Radians_per_second" rad/s
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# GIMBAL_DEVICE_ATTITUDE_STATUS (ID 285)
# Message reporting the status of a gimbal device. This message should be
# broadcast by a gimbal device component at a low regular rate (e.g. 5 Hz).
# For the angles encoded in the quaternion and the angular velocities holds:
# If the flag GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_IN_VEHICLE_FRAME is set, then they are
# relative to the vehicle heading (vehicle frame). If the flag
# GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_IN_EARTH_FRAME is set, then they are relative to
# absolute North (earth frame). If neither of these flags are set, then (for
# backwards compatibility) it holds: If the flag
# GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_LOCK is set, then they are relative to absolute
# North (earth frame), else they are relative to the vehicle heading
# (vehicle frame). Other conditions of the flags are not allowed. The
# quaternion and angular velocities in the other frame can be calculated
# from delta_yaw and delta_yaw_velocity as q_earth = q_delta_yaw * q_vehicle
# and w_earth = w_delta_yaw_velocity + w_vehicle (if not NaN). If neither
# the GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_IN_VEHICLE_FRAME nor the
# GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_IN_EARTH_FRAME flag is set, then (for backwards
# compatibility) the data in the delta_yaw and delta_yaw_velocity fields are
# to be ignored. New implementations should always set either
# GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_IN_VEHICLE_FRAME or
# GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_IN_EARTH_FRAME, and always should set delta_yaw
# and delta_yaw_velocity either to the proper value or NaN.
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> GIMBAL_DEVICE_ATTITUDE_STATUS LITTLE_ENDIAN "Message reporting the status of a gimbal device. This message should be broadcast by a gimbal dev..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 285} %>
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_SYSTEM 8 UINT "System ID"
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_COMPONENT 8 UINT "Component ID"
  APPEND_ITEM TIME_BOOT_MS 32 UINT "Timestamp (time since system boot)."
    UNITS "Milliseconds" ms
  APPEND_ITEM FLAGS 16 UINT "Current gimbal flags set."
  APPEND_ARRAY_ITEM Q 32 FLOAT 128 "Quaternion components, w, x, y, z (1 0 0 0 is the null-rotation). The frame i..."
  APPEND_ITEM ANGULAR_VELOCITY_X 32 FLOAT "X component of angular velocity (positive: rolling to the right). The frame i..."
    UNITS "Radians_per_second" rad/s
  APPEND_ITEM ANGULAR_VELOCITY_Y 32 FLOAT "Y component of angular velocity (positive: pitching up). The frame is describ..."
    UNITS "Radians_per_second" rad/s
  APPEND_ITEM ANGULAR_VELOCITY_Z 32 FLOAT "Z component of angular velocity (positive: yawing to the right). The frame is..."
    UNITS "Radians_per_second" rad/s
  APPEND_ITEM FAILURE_FLAGS 32 UINT "Failure flags (0 for no failure)"
  # MAVLink 2 Extension Fields
  APPEND_ITEM DELTA_YAW 32 FLOAT "Yaw angle relating the quaternions in earth and body frames (see message desc..."
    UNITS "Radians" rad
  APPEND_ITEM DELTA_YAW_VELOCITY 32 FLOAT "Yaw angular velocity relating the angular velocities in earth and body frames..."
    UNITS "Radians_per_second" rad/s
  APPEND_ITEM GIMBAL_DEVICE_ID 8 UINT "This field is to be used if the gimbal manager and the gimbal device are the ..."
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# AUTOPILOT_STATE_FOR_GIMBAL_DEVICE (ID 286)
# Low level message containing autopilot state relevant for a gimbal device.
# This message is to be sent from the autopilot to the gimbal device
# component. The data of this message are for the gimbal device's estimator
# corrections, in particular horizon compensation, as well as indicates
# autopilot control intentions, e.g. feed forward angular control in the
# z-axis.
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> AUTOPILOT_STATE_FOR_GIMBAL_DEVICE LITTLE_ENDIAN "Low level message containing autopilot state relevant for a gimbal device. This message is to be ..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 286} %>
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_SYSTEM 8 UINT "System ID"
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_COMPONENT 8 UINT "Component ID"
  APPEND_ITEM TIME_BOOT_US 64 UINT "Timestamp (time since system boot)."
    UNITS "Microseconds" us
  APPEND_ARRAY_ITEM Q 32 FLOAT 128 "Quaternion components of autopilot attitude: w, x, y, z (1 0 0 0 is the null-..."
  APPEND_ITEM Q_ESTIMATED_DELAY_US 32 UINT "Estimated delay of the attitude data. 0 if unknown."
    UNITS "Microseconds" us
  APPEND_ITEM VX 32 FLOAT "X Speed in NED (North, East, Down). NAN if unknown."
    UNITS "Meters_per_second" m/s
  APPEND_ITEM VY 32 FLOAT "Y Speed in NED (North, East, Down). NAN if unknown."
    UNITS "Meters_per_second" m/s
  APPEND_ITEM VZ 32 FLOAT "Z Speed in NED (North, East, Down). NAN if unknown."
    UNITS "Meters_per_second" m/s
  APPEND_ITEM V_ESTIMATED_DELAY_US 32 UINT "Estimated delay of the speed data. 0 if unknown."
    UNITS "Microseconds" us
  APPEND_ITEM FEED_FORWARD_ANGULAR_VELOCITY_Z 32 FLOAT "Feed forward Z component of angular velocity (positive: yawing to the right)...."
    UNITS "Radians_per_second" rad/s
  APPEND_ITEM ESTIMATOR_STATUS 16 UINT "Bitmap indicating which estimator outputs are valid."
  APPEND_ITEM LANDED_STATE 8 UINT "The landed state. Is set to MAV_LANDED_STATE_UNDEFINED if landed state is unk..."
    STATE MAV_LANDED_STATE_UNDEFINED 0
    STATE MAV_LANDED_STATE_ON_GROUND 1
    STATE MAV_LANDED_STATE_IN_AIR 2
    STATE MAV_LANDED_STATE_TAKEOFF 3
    STATE MAV_LANDED_STATE_LANDING 4
  # MAVLink 2 Extension Fields
  APPEND_ITEM ANGULAR_VELOCITY_Z 32 FLOAT "Z component of angular velocity in NED (North, East, Down). NaN if unknown."
    UNITS "Radians_per_second" rad/s
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# GIMBAL_MANAGER_SET_PITCHYAW (ID 287)
# Set gimbal manager pitch and yaw angles (high rate message). This message
# is to be sent to the gimbal manager (e.g. from a ground station) and will
# be ignored by gimbal devices. Angles and rates can be set to NaN according
# to use case. Use MAV_CMD_DO_GIMBAL_MANAGER_PITCHYAW for low-rate
# adjustments that require confirmation.
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> GIMBAL_MANAGER_SET_PITCHYAW LITTLE_ENDIAN "Set gimbal manager pitch and yaw angles (high rate message). This message is to be sent to the gi..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 287} %>
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_SYSTEM 8 UINT "System ID"
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_COMPONENT 8 UINT "Component ID"
  APPEND_ITEM FLAGS 32 UINT "High level gimbal manager flags to use."
  APPEND_ITEM GIMBAL_DEVICE_ID 8 UINT "Component ID of gimbal device to address (or 1-6 for non-MAVLink gimbal), 0 f..."
  APPEND_ITEM PITCH 32 FLOAT "Pitch angle (positive: up, negative: down, NaN to be ignored)."
    UNITS "Radians" rad
  APPEND_ITEM YAW 32 FLOAT "Yaw angle (positive: to the right, negative: to the left, NaN to be ignored)."
    UNITS "Radians" rad
  APPEND_ITEM PITCH_RATE 32 FLOAT "Pitch angular rate (positive: up, negative: down, NaN to be ignored)."
    UNITS "Radians_per_second" rad/s
  APPEND_ITEM YAW_RATE 32 FLOAT "Yaw angular rate (positive: to the right, negative: to the left, NaN to be ig..."
    UNITS "Radians_per_second" rad/s
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# GIMBAL_MANAGER_SET_MANUAL_CONTROL (ID 288)

  APPEND_ITEM PITCH 32 FLOAT "Pitch angle unitless (-1..1, positive: up, negative: down, NaN to be ignored)."
  APPEND_ITEM YAW 32 FLOAT "Yaw angle unitless (-1..1, positive: to the right, negative: to the left, NaN..."
  APPEND_ITEM PITCH_RATE 32 FLOAT "Pitch angular rate unitless (-1..1, positive: up, negative: down, NaN to be i..."
  APPEND_ITEM YAW_RATE 32 FLOAT "Yaw angular rate unitless (-1..1, positive: to the right, negative: to the le..."
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

    UNITS "Amps" A

# ============================================================================
# PROTOCOL_VERSION (ID 300)
# Version and capability of protocol version. This message can be requested
# with MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE and is used as part of the handshaking to
# establish which MAVLink version should be used on the network. Every node
# should respond to a request for PROTOCOL_VERSION to enable the
# handshaking. Library implementers should consider adding this into the
# default decoding state machine to allow the protocol core to respond
# directly.
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> PROTOCOL_VERSION LITTLE_ENDIAN "Version and capability of protocol version. This message can be requested with MAV_CMD_REQUEST_ME..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 300} %>
  APPEND_ITEM VERSION 16 UINT "Currently active MAVLink version number * 100: v1.0 is 100, v2.0 is 200, etc."
  APPEND_ITEM MIN_VERSION 16 UINT "Minimum MAVLink version supported"
  APPEND_ITEM MAX_VERSION 16 UINT "Maximum MAVLink version supported (set to the same value as version by default)"
  APPEND_ARRAY_ITEM SPEC_VERSION_HASH 8 UINT 64 "The first 8 bytes (not characters printed in hex!) of the git hash."
  APPEND_ARRAY_ITEM LIBRARY_VERSION_HASH 8 UINT 64 "The first 8 bytes (not characters printed in hex!) of the git hash."
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

    UNITS "Meters" m

    UNITS "Meters" m

  APPEND_ITEM NAME 160 STRING "The vessel name"

    UNITS "Seconds" s
  APPEND_ITEM FLAGS 16 UINT "Bitmask to indicate various statuses including valid data fields"
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# PARAM_EXT_VALUE (ID 322)
# Emit the value of a parameter. The inclusion of param_count and
# param_index in the message allows the recipient to keep track of received
# parameters and allows them to re-request missing parameters after a loss
# or timeout.
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> PARAM_EXT_VALUE LITTLE_ENDIAN "Emit the value of a parameter. The inclusion of param_count and param_index in the message allows..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 322} %>

  APPEND_ITEM PARAM_VALUE 1024 STRING "Parameter value"
