    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_UINT8 1
    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_INT8 2
    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_UINT16 3
    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_INT16 4
    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_UINT32 5
    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_INT32 6
    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_UINT64 7
    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_INT64 8
    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_REAL32 9
    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_REAL64 10
    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_CUSTOM 11
  APPEND_ITEM PARAM_COUNT 16 UINT "Total number of parameters"
  APPEND_ITEM PARAM_INDEX 16 UINT "Index of this parameter"
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# PARAM_EXT_SET (ID 323)
# Set a parameter value. In order to deal with message loss (and
# retransmission of PARAM_EXT_SET), when setting a parameter value and the
# new value is the same as the current value, you will immediately get a
# PARAM_ACK_ACCEPTED response. If the current state is
# PARAM_ACK_IN_PROGRESS, you will accordingly receive a
# PARAM_ACK_IN_PROGRESS in response.
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> PARAM_EXT_SET LITTLE_ENDIAN "Set a parameter value. In order to deal with message loss (and retransmission of PARAM_EXT_SET), ..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 323} %>
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_SYSTEM 8 UINT "System ID"
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_COMPONENT 8 UINT "Component ID"
  APPEND_ITEM PARAM_ID 128 STRING "Parameter id, terminated by NULL if the length is less than 16 human-readable..."
  APPEND_ITEM PARAM_VALUE 1024 STRING "Parameter value"
  APPEND_ITEM PARAM_TYPE 8 UINT "Parameter type."
    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_UINT8 1
    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_INT8 2
    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_UINT16 3
    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_INT16 4
    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_UINT32 5
    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_INT32 6
    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_UINT64 7
    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_INT64 8
    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_REAL32 9
    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_REAL64 10
    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_CUSTOM 11
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# PARAM_EXT_ACK (ID 324)
# Response from a PARAM_EXT_SET message.
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> PARAM_EXT_ACK LITTLE_ENDIAN "Response from a PARAM_EXT_SET message."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 324} %>
  APPEND_ITEM PARAM_ID 128 STRING "Parameter id, terminated by NULL if the length is less than 16 human-readable..."
  APPEND_ITEM PARAM_VALUE 1024 STRING "Parameter value (new value if PARAM_ACK_ACCEPTED, current value otherwise)"
  APPEND_ITEM PARAM_TYPE 8 UINT "Parameter type."
    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_UINT8 1
    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_INT8 2
    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_UINT16 3
    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_INT16 4
    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_UINT32 5
    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_INT32 6
    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_UINT64 7
    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_INT64 8
    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_REAL32 9
    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_REAL64 10
    STATE MAV_PARAM_EXT_TYPE_CUSTOM 11
  APPEND_ITEM PARAM_RESULT 8 UINT "Result code."
    STATE PARAM_ACK_ACCEPTED 0
    STATE PARAM_ACK_VALUE_UNSUPPORTED 1
    STATE PARAM_ACK_FAILED 2
    STATE PARAM_ACK_IN_PROGRESS 3
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

    UNITS "Meters" m

    UNITS "Meters" m

    UNITS "Meters" m

    UNITS "Radians_per_second" rad/s

  # MAVLink 2 Extension Fields
  APPEND_ITEM RESET_COUNTER 8 UINT "Estimate reset counter. This should be incremented when the estimate resets i..."
  APPEND_ITEM ESTIMATOR_TYPE 8 UINT "Type of estimator that is providing the odometry."
    STATE MAV_ESTIMATOR_TYPE_UNKNOWN 0
    STATE MAV_ESTIMATOR_TYPE_NAIVE 1
    STATE MAV_ESTIMATOR_TYPE_VISION 2
    STATE MAV_ESTIMATOR_TYPE_VIO 3
    STATE MAV_ESTIMATOR_TYPE_GPS 4
    STATE MAV_ESTIMATOR_TYPE_GPS_INS 5
    STATE MAV_ESTIMATOR_TYPE_MOCAP 6
    STATE MAV_ESTIMATOR_TYPE_LIDAR 7
    STATE MAV_ESTIMATOR_TYPE_AUTOPILOT 8
  APPEND_ITEM QUALITY 8 INT "Optional odometry quality metric as a percentage. -1 = odometry has failed, 0..."
    UNITS "Percent" %
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# FUEL_STATUS (ID 371)
# Fuel status. This message provides "generic" fuel level information for in
# a GCS and for triggering failsafes in an autopilot. The fuel type and
# associated units for fields in this message are defined in the enum
# MAV_FUEL_TYPE. The reported `consumed_fuel` and `remaining_fuel` must only
# be supplied if measured: they must not be inferred from the `maximum_fuel`
# and the other value. A recipient can assume that if these fields are
# supplied they are accurate. If not provided, the recipient can infer
# `remaining_fuel` from `maximum_fuel` and `consumed_fuel` on the assumption
# that the fuel was initially at its maximum (this is what battery monitors
# assume). Note however that this is an assumption, and the UI should prompt
# the user appropriately (i.e. notify user that they should fill the tank
# before boot). This kind of information may also be sent in fuel-specific
# messages such as BATTERY_STATUS_V2. If both messages are sent for the same
# fuel system, the ids and corresponding information must match. This should
# be streamed (nominally at 0.1 Hz).
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> FUEL_STATUS LITTLE_ENDIAN "Fuel status. This message provides 'generic' fuel level information for in a GCS and for triggeri..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 371} %>
  APPEND_ITEM ID 8 UINT "Fuel ID. Must match ID of other messages for same fuel system, such as BATTER..."
  APPEND_ITEM MAXIMUM_FUEL 32 FLOAT "Capacity when full. Must be provided."
  APPEND_ITEM CONSUMED_FUEL 32 FLOAT "Consumed fuel (measured). This value should not be inferred: if not measured ..."
  APPEND_ITEM REMAINING_FUEL 32 FLOAT "Remaining fuel until empty (measured). The value should not be inferred: if n..."
  APPEND_ITEM PERCENT_REMAINING 8 UINT "Percentage of remaining fuel, relative to full. Values: [0-100], UINT8_MAX: f..."
    UNITS "Percent" %
  APPEND_ITEM FLOW_RATE 32 FLOAT "Positive value when emptying/using, and negative if filling/replacing. NaN: f..."
  APPEND_ITEM TEMPERATURE 32 FLOAT "Fuel temperature. NaN: field not provided."
    UNITS "Kelvin" K
  APPEND_ITEM FUEL_TYPE 32 UINT "Fuel type. Defines units for fuel capacity and consumption fields above."
    STATE MAV_FUEL_TYPE_UNKNOWN 0
    STATE MAV_FUEL_TYPE_LIQUID 1
    STATE MAV_FUEL_TYPE_GAS 2
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# BATTERY_INFO (ID 372)
# Battery information that is static, or requires infrequent update. This
# message should requested using MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE and/or streamed at
# very low rate. BATTERY_STATUS_V2 is used for higher-rate battery status
# information.
# ============================================================================

  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 372} %>
  APPEND_ITEM ID 8 UINT "Battery ID"
  APPEND_ITEM BATTERY_FUNCTION 8 UINT "Function of the battery."
    STATE MAV_BATTERY_FUNCTION_UNKNOWN 0
    STATE MAV_BATTERY_FUNCTION_ALL 1
    STATE MAV_BATTERY_FUNCTION_PROPULSION 2
    STATE MAV_BATTERY_FUNCTION_AVIONICS 3
    STATE MAV_BATTERY_FUNCTION_PAYLOAD 4
  APPEND_ITEM TYPE 8 UINT "Type (chemistry) of the battery."
    STATE MAV_BATTERY_TYPE_UNKNOWN 0
    STATE MAV_BATTERY_TYPE_LIPO 1
    STATE MAV_BATTERY_TYPE_LIFE 2
    STATE MAV_BATTERY_TYPE_LION 3
    STATE MAV_BATTERY_TYPE_NIMH 4
  APPEND_ITEM STATE_OF_HEALTH 8 UINT "State of Health (SOH) estimate. Typically 100% at the time of manufacture and..."
    UNITS "Percent" %
  APPEND_ITEM CELLS_IN_SERIES 8 UINT "Number of battery cells in series. 0: field not provided."
  APPEND_ITEM CYCLE_COUNT 16 UINT "Lifetime count of the number of charge/discharge cycles (https://en.wikipedia..."
  APPEND_ITEM WEIGHT 16 UINT "Battery weight. 0: field not provided."
    UNITS "g" g
  APPEND_ITEM DISCHARGE_MINIMUM_VOLTAGE 32 FLOAT "Minimum per-cell voltage when discharging. 0: field not provided."
    UNITS "V" V

    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

    STATE MAV_TUNNEL_PAYLOAD_TYPE_UNKNOWN 0
    STATE MAV_TUNNEL_PAYLOAD_TYPE_STORM32_RESERVED0 200
    STATE MAV_TUNNEL_PAYLOAD_TYPE_STORM32_RESERVED1 201
    STATE MAV_TUNNEL_PAYLOAD_TYPE_STORM32_RESERVED2 202
    STATE MAV_TUNNEL_PAYLOAD_TYPE_STORM32_RESERVED3 203
    STATE MAV_TUNNEL_PAYLOAD_TYPE_STORM32_RESERVED4 204
    STATE MAV_TUNNEL_PAYLOAD_TYPE_STORM32_RESERVED5 205
    STATE MAV_TUNNEL_PAYLOAD_TYPE_STORM32_RESERVED6 206
    STATE MAV_TUNNEL_PAYLOAD_TYPE_STORM32_RESERVED7 207
    STATE MAV_TUNNEL_PAYLOAD_TYPE_STORM32_RESERVED8 208
    STATE MAV_TUNNEL_PAYLOAD_TYPE_STORM32_RESERVED9 209
    STATE MAV_TUNNEL_PAYLOAD_TYPE_MODALAI_REMOTE_OSD 210
    STATE MAV_TUNNEL_PAYLOAD_TYPE_MODALAI_ESC_UART_PASSTHRU 211
    STATE MAV_TUNNEL_PAYLOAD_TYPE_MODALAI_IO_UART_PASSTHRU 212
  APPEND_ITEM PAYLOAD_LENGTH 8 UINT "Length of the data transported in payload"
  APPEND_ARRAY_ITEM PAYLOAD 8 UINT 1024 "Variable length payload. The payload length is defined by payload_length. The..."
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# CAN_FILTER_MODIFY (ID 388)
# Modify the filter of what CAN messages to forward over the mavlink. This
# can be used to make CAN forwarding work well on low bandwidth links. The
# filtering is applied on bits 8 to 24 of the CAN id (2nd and 3rd bytes)
# which corresponds to the DroneCAN message ID for DroneCAN. Filters with
# more than 16 IDs can be constructed by sending multiple CAN_FILTER_MODIFY
# messages.
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> CAN_FILTER_MODIFY LITTLE_ENDIAN "Modify the filter of what CAN messages to forward over the mavlink. This can be used to make CAN ..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 388} %>
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_SYSTEM 8 UINT "System ID."
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_COMPONENT 8 UINT "Component ID."
  APPEND_ITEM BUS 8 UINT "bus number"
  APPEND_ITEM OPERATION 8 UINT "what operation to perform on the filter list. See CAN_FILTER_OP enum."
    STATE CAN_FILTER_REPLACE 0
    STATE CAN_FILTER_ADD 1
    STATE CAN_FILTER_REMOVE 2
  APPEND_ITEM NUM_IDS 8 UINT "number of IDs in filter list"
  APPEND_ARRAY_ITEM IDS 16 UINT 256 "filter IDs, length num_ids"
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# COMPONENT_METADATA (ID 397)
# Component metadata message, which may be requested using
# MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE. This contains the MAVLink FTP URI and CRC for the
# component's general metadata file. The file must be hosted on the
# component, and may be xz compressed. The file CRC can be used for file
# caching. The general metadata file can be read to get the locations of
# other metadata files (COMP_METADATA_TYPE) and translations, which may be
# hosted either on the vehicle or the internet. For more information see:
# https://mavlink.io/en/services/component_information.html. Note: Camera
# components should use CAMERA_INFORMATION instead, and autopilots may use
# both this message and AUTOPILOT_VERSION.
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> COMPONENT_METADATA LITTLE_ENDIAN "Component metadata message, which may be requested using MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE. This contains t..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 397} %>
  APPEND_ITEM TIME_BOOT_MS 32 UINT "Timestamp (time since system boot)."
    UNITS "Milliseconds" ms
  APPEND_ITEM FILE_CRC 32 UINT "CRC32 of the general metadata file."
  APPEND_ITEM URI 800 STRING "MAVLink FTP URI for the general metadata file (COMP_METADATA_TYPE_GENERAL), w..."
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# EVENT (ID 410)
# Event message. Each new event from a particular component gets a new
# sequence number. The same message might be sent multiple times if
# (re-)requested. Most events are broadcast, some can be specific to a
# target component (as receivers keep track of the sequence for missed
# events, all events need to be broadcast. Thus we use destination_component
# instead of target_component).
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> EVENT LITTLE_ENDIAN "Event message. Each new event from a particular component gets a new sequence number. The same me..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 410} %>
  APPEND_ITEM DESTINATION_COMPONENT 8 UINT "Component ID"
  APPEND_ITEM DESTINATION_SYSTEM 8 UINT "System ID"
  APPEND_ITEM ID 32 UINT "Event ID (as defined in the component metadata)"
  APPEND_ITEM EVENT_TIME_BOOT_MS 32 UINT "Timestamp (time since system boot when the event happened)."
    UNITS "Milliseconds" ms
  APPEND_ITEM SEQUENCE 16 UINT "Sequence number."
  APPEND_ITEM LOG_LEVELS 8 UINT "Log levels: 4 bits MSB: internal (for logging purposes), 4 bits LSB: external..."
  APPEND_ARRAY_ITEM ARGUMENTS 8 UINT 320 "Arguments (depend on event ID)."
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# REQUEST_EVENT (ID 412)
# Request one or more events to be (re-)sent. If
# first_sequence==last_sequence, only a single event is requested. Note that
# first_sequence can be larger than last_sequence (because the sequence
# number can wrap). Each sequence will trigger an EVENT or EVENT_ERROR
# response.
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> REQUEST_EVENT LITTLE_ENDIAN "Request one or more events to be (re-)sent. If first_sequence==last_sequence, only a single event..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 412} %>

  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_COMPONENT 8 UINT "Component ID"
  APPEND_ITEM FIRST_SEQUENCE 16 UINT "First sequence number of the requested event."
  APPEND_ITEM LAST_SEQUENCE 16 UINT "Last sequence number of the requested event."
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_COMPONENT 8 UINT "Component ID"

    STATE MAV_EVENT_ERROR_REASON_UNAVAILABLE 0

    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# AVAILABLE_MODES (ID 435)
# Information about a flight mode. The message can be enumerated to get
# information for all modes, or requested for a particular mode, using
# MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE. Specify 0 in param2 to request that the message
# is emitted for all available modes or the specific index for just one
# mode. The modes must be available/settable for the current vehicle/frame
# type. Each mode should only be emitted once (even if it is both standard
# and custom). Note that the current mode should be emitted in CURRENT_MODE,
# and that if the mode list can change then AVAILABLE_MODES_MONITOR must be
# emitted on first change and subsequently streamed. See
# https://mavlink.io/en/services/standard_modes.html
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> AVAILABLE_MODES LITTLE_ENDIAN "Information about a flight mode. The message can be enumerated to get information for all modes, ..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 435} %>
  APPEND_ITEM NUMBER_MODES 8 UINT "The total number of available modes for the current vehicle type."
  APPEND_ITEM MODE_INDEX 8 UINT "The current mode index within number_modes, indexed from 1. The index is not ..."
  APPEND_ITEM STANDARD_MODE 8 UINT "Standard mode."
    STATE MAV_STANDARD_MODE_NON_STANDARD 0
    STATE MAV_STANDARD_MODE_POSITION_HOLD 1
    STATE MAV_STANDARD_MODE_ORBIT 2
    STATE MAV_STANDARD_MODE_CRUISE 3
    STATE MAV_STANDARD_MODE_ALTITUDE_HOLD 4
    STATE MAV_STANDARD_MODE_SAFE_RECOVERY 5
    STATE MAV_STANDARD_MODE_MISSION 6
    STATE MAV_STANDARD_MODE_LAND 7
    STATE MAV_STANDARD_MODE_TAKEOFF 8
  APPEND_ITEM CUSTOM_MODE 32 UINT "A bitfield for use for autopilot-specific flags"
  APPEND_ITEM PROPERTIES 32 UINT "Mode properties."
  APPEND_ITEM MODE_NAME 280 STRING "Name of custom mode, with null termination character. Should be omitted for s..."
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# CURRENT_MODE (ID 436)
# Get the current mode. This should be emitted on any mode change, and
# broadcast at low rate (nominally 0.5 Hz). It may be requested using
# MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE. See
# https://mavlink.io/en/services/standard_modes.html
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> CURRENT_MODE LITTLE_ENDIAN "Get the current mode. This should be emitted on any mode change, and broadcast at low rate (nomin..."

    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# AVAILABLE_MODES_MONITOR (ID 437)
# A change to the sequence number indicates that the set of AVAILABLE_MODES
# has changed. A receiver must re-request all available modes whenever the
# sequence number changes. This is only emitted after the first change and
# should then be broadcast at low rate (nominally 0.3 Hz) and on change. See
# https://mavlink.io/en/services/standard_modes.html
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> AVAILABLE_MODES_MONITOR LITTLE_ENDIAN "A change to the sequence number indicates that the set of AVAILABLE_MODES has changed. A receiver..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 437} %>
  APPEND_ITEM SEQ 8 UINT "Sequence number. The value iterates sequentially whenever AVAILABLE_MODES cha..."
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# ILLUMINATOR_STATUS (ID 440)
# Illuminator status
# ============================================================================

  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 440} %>
  APPEND_ITEM UPTIME_MS 32 UINT "Time since the start-up of the illuminator in ms"
    UNITS "Milliseconds" ms
  APPEND_ITEM ENABLE 8 UINT "0: Illuminators OFF, 1: Illuminators ON"
  APPEND_ITEM MODE_BITMASK 8 UINT "Supported illuminator modes"
    STATE ILLUMINATOR_MODE_UNKNOWN 0
    STATE ILLUMINATOR_MODE_INTERNAL_CONTROL 1
    STATE ILLUMINATOR_MODE_EXTERNAL_SYNC 2
  APPEND_ITEM ERROR_STATUS 32 UINT "Errors"
  APPEND_ITEM MODE 8 UINT "Illuminator mode"
    STATE ILLUMINATOR_MODE_UNKNOWN 0
    STATE ILLUMINATOR_MODE_INTERNAL_CONTROL 1
    STATE ILLUMINATOR_MODE_EXTERNAL_SYNC 2
  APPEND_ITEM BRIGHTNESS 32 FLOAT "Illuminator brightness"
    UNITS "Percent" %
  APPEND_ITEM STROBE_PERIOD 32 FLOAT "Illuminator strobing period in seconds"
    UNITS "Seconds" s
  APPEND_ITEM STROBE_DUTY_CYCLE 32 FLOAT "Illuminator strobing duty cycle"
    UNITS "Percent" %
  APPEND_ITEM TEMP_C 32 FLOAT "Temperature in Celsius"
  APPEND_ITEM MIN_STROBE_PERIOD 32 FLOAT "Minimum strobing period in seconds"
    UNITS "Seconds" s
  APPEND_ITEM MAX_STROBE_PERIOD 32 FLOAT "Maximum strobing period in seconds"
    UNITS "Seconds" s
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# OPEN_DRONE_ID_BASIC_ID (ID 12900)
# Data for filling the OpenDroneID Basic ID message. This and the below
# messages are primarily meant for feeding data to/from an OpenDroneID
# implementation. E.g. https://github.com/opendroneid/opendroneid-core-c.
# These messages are compatible with the ASTM F3411 Remote ID standard and
# the ASD-STAN prEN 4709-002 Direct Remote ID standard. Additional
# information and usage of these messages is documented at
# https://mavlink.io/en/services/opendroneid.html.
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> OPEN_DRONE_ID_BASIC_ID LITTLE_ENDIAN "Data for filling the OpenDroneID Basic ID message. This and the below messages are primarily mean..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 12900} %>
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_SYSTEM 8 UINT "System ID (0 for broadcast)."
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_COMPONENT 8 UINT "Component ID (0 for broadcast)."
  APPEND_ARRAY_ITEM ID_OR_MAC 8 UINT 160 "Only used for drone ID data received from other UAs. See detailed description..."
  APPEND_ITEM ID_TYPE 8 UINT "Indicates the format for the uas_id field of this message."
    STATE MAV_ODID_ID_TYPE_NONE 0
    STATE MAV_ODID_ID_TYPE_SERIAL_NUMBER 1
    STATE MAV_ODID_ID_TYPE_CAA_REGISTRATION_ID 2
    STATE MAV_ODID_ID_TYPE_UTM_ASSIGNED_UUID 3
    STATE MAV_ODID_ID_TYPE_SPECIFIC_SESSION_ID 4
  APPEND_ITEM UA_TYPE 8 UINT "Indicates the type of UA (Unmanned Aircraft)."
    STATE MAV_ODID_UA_TYPE_NONE 0
    STATE MAV_ODID_UA_TYPE_AEROPLANE 1
    STATE MAV_ODID_UA_TYPE_HELICOPTER_OR_MULTIROTOR 2
    STATE MAV_ODID_UA_TYPE_GYROPLANE 3
    STATE MAV_ODID_UA_TYPE_HYBRID_LIFT 4
    STATE MAV_ODID_UA_TYPE_ORNITHOPTER 5
    STATE MAV_ODID_UA_TYPE_GLIDER 6
    STATE MAV_ODID_UA_TYPE_KITE 7
    STATE MAV_ODID_UA_TYPE_FREE_BALLOON 8
    STATE MAV_ODID_UA_TYPE_CAPTIVE_BALLOON 9
    STATE MAV_ODID_UA_TYPE_AIRSHIP 10
    STATE MAV_ODID_UA_TYPE_FREE_FALL_PARACHUTE 11
    STATE MAV_ODID_UA_TYPE_ROCKET 12
    STATE MAV_ODID_UA_TYPE_TETHERED_POWERED_AIRCRAFT 13
    STATE MAV_ODID_UA_TYPE_GROUND_OBSTACLE 14
  APPEND_ARRAY_ITEM UAS_ID 8 UINT 160 "UAS (Unmanned Aircraft System) ID following the format specified by id_type. ..."
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# OPEN_DRONE_ID_LOCATION (ID 12901)

# direction and speed of the aircraft.
# ============================================================================

    STATE MAV_ODID_STATUS_GROUND 1
    STATE MAV_ODID_STATUS_AIRBORNE 2
    STATE MAV_ODID_STATUS_EMERGENCY 3
    STATE MAV_ODID_STATUS_REMOTE_ID_SYSTEM_FAILURE 4

    UNITS "Centidegrees" cdeg

    UNITS "Centimeters_per_second" cm/s
  APPEND_ITEM SPEED_VERTICAL 16 INT "The vertical speed. Up is positive. If unknown: 6300 cm/s. If speed is larger..."
    UNITS "Centimeters_per_second" cm/s

    UNITS "Degrees_E7" degE7
  APPEND_ITEM LONGITUDE 32 INT "Current longitude of the unmanned aircraft. If unknown: 0 (both Lat/Lon)."
    UNITS "Degrees_E7" degE7
  APPEND_ITEM ALTITUDE_BAROMETRIC 32 FLOAT "The altitude calculated from the barometric pressure. Reference is against 29..."
    UNITS "Meters" m
  APPEND_ITEM ALTITUDE_GEODETIC 32 FLOAT "The geodetic altitude as defined by WGS84. If unknown: -1000 m."
    UNITS "Meters" m

    STATE MAV_ODID_HEIGHT_REF_OVER_TAKEOFF 0
    STATE MAV_ODID_HEIGHT_REF_OVER_GROUND 1

    UNITS "Meters" m

    STATE MAV_ODID_HOR_ACC_4NM 2

    STATE MAV_ODID_HOR_ACC_0_3NM 6
    STATE MAV_ODID_HOR_ACC_0_1NM 7
    STATE MAV_ODID_HOR_ACC_0_05NM 8
    STATE MAV_ODID_HOR_ACC_30_METER 9

    STATE MAV_ODID_HOR_ACC_3_METER 11

    STATE MAV_ODID_VER_ACC_3_METER 5
    STATE MAV_ODID_VER_ACC_1_METER 6

# ============================================================================
# OPEN_DRONE_ID_AUTHENTICATION (ID 12902)
# Data for filling the OpenDroneID Authentication message. The
# Authentication Message defines a field that can provide a means of
# authenticity for the identity of the UAS (Unmanned Aircraft System). The
# Authentication message can have two different formats. For data page 0,
# the fields PageCount, Length and TimeStamp are present and AuthData is
# only 17 bytes. For data page 1 through 15, PageCount, Length and TimeStamp
# are not present and the size of AuthData is 23 bytes.
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> OPEN_DRONE_ID_AUTHENTICATION LITTLE_ENDIAN "Data for filling the OpenDroneID Authentication message. The Authentication Message defines a fie..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 12902} %>
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_SYSTEM 8 UINT "System ID (0 for broadcast)."
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_COMPONENT 8 UINT "Component ID (0 for broadcast)."
  APPEND_ARRAY_ITEM ID_OR_MAC 8 UINT 160 "Only used for drone ID data received from other UAs. See detailed description..."
  APPEND_ITEM AUTHENTICATION_TYPE 8 UINT "Indicates the type of authentication."
    STATE MAV_ODID_AUTH_TYPE_NONE 0
    STATE MAV_ODID_AUTH_TYPE_UAS_ID_SIGNATURE 1
    STATE MAV_ODID_AUTH_TYPE_OPERATOR_ID_SIGNATURE 2
    STATE MAV_ODID_AUTH_TYPE_MESSAGE_SET_SIGNATURE 3
    STATE MAV_ODID_AUTH_TYPE_NETWORK_REMOTE_ID 4
    STATE MAV_ODID_AUTH_TYPE_SPECIFIC_AUTHENTICATION 5
  APPEND_ITEM DATA_PAGE 8 UINT "Allowed range is 0 - 15."
  APPEND_ITEM LAST_PAGE_INDEX 8 UINT "This field is only present for page 0. Allowed range is 0 - 15. See the descr..."
  APPEND_ITEM LENGTH 8 UINT "This field is only present for page 0. Total bytes of authentication_data fro..."
    UNITS "Bytes" B
  APPEND_ITEM TIMESTAMP 32 UINT "This field is only present for page 0. 32 bit Unix Timestamp in seconds since..."
    UNITS "Seconds" s
  APPEND_ARRAY_ITEM AUTHENTICATION_DATA 8 UINT 184 "Opaque authentication data. For page 0, the size is only 17 bytes. For other ..."
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# OPEN_DRONE_ID_SELF_ID (ID 12903)
# Data for filling the OpenDroneID Self ID message. The Self ID Message is
# an opportunity for the operator to (optionally) declare their identity and
# purpose of the flight. This message can provide additional information
# that could reduce the threat profile of a UA (Unmanned Aircraft) flying in
# a particular area or manner. This message can also be used to provide
# optional additional clarification in an emergency/remote ID system failure
# situation.
# ============================================================================

  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_COMPONENT 8 UINT "Component ID (0 for broadcast)."
  APPEND_ARRAY_ITEM ID_OR_MAC 8 UINT 160 "Only used for drone ID data received from other UAs. See detailed description..."
  APPEND_ITEM DESCRIPTION_TYPE 8 UINT "Indicates the type of the description field."
    STATE MAV_ODID_DESC_TYPE_TEXT 0
    STATE MAV_ODID_DESC_TYPE_EMERGENCY 1
    STATE MAV_ODID_DESC_TYPE_EXTENDED_STATUS 2
  APPEND_ITEM DESCRIPTION 184 STRING "Text description or numeric value expressed as ASCII characters. Shall be fil..."
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

  APPEND_ARRAY_ITEM ID_OR_MAC 8 UINT 160 "Only used for drone ID data received from other UAs. See detailed description..."

    STATE MAV_ODID_OPERATOR_LOCATION_TYPE_TAKEOFF 0
    STATE MAV_ODID_OPERATOR_LOCATION_TYPE_LIVE_GNSS 1
    STATE MAV_ODID_OPERATOR_LOCATION_TYPE_FIXED 2
  APPEND_ITEM CLASSIFICATION_TYPE 8 UINT "Specifies the classification type of the UA."
    STATE MAV_ODID_CLASSIFICATION_TYPE_UNDECLARED 0
    STATE MAV_ODID_CLASSIFICATION_TYPE_EU 1
  APPEND_ITEM OPERATOR_LATITUDE 32 INT "Latitude of the operator. If unknown: 0 (both Lat/Lon)."
    UNITS "Degrees_E7" degE7
  APPEND_ITEM OPERATOR_LONGITUDE 32 INT "Longitude of the operator. If unknown: 0 (both Lat/Lon)."
    UNITS "Degrees_E7" degE7

  APPEND_ITEM AREA_RADIUS 16 UINT "Radius of the cylindrical area of the group or formation (default 0). Used on..."
    UNITS "Meters" m
  APPEND_ITEM AREA_CEILING 32 FLOAT "Area Operations Ceiling relative to WGS84. If unknown: -1000 m. Used only for..."
    UNITS "Meters" m
  APPEND_ITEM AREA_FLOOR 32 FLOAT "Area Operations Floor relative to WGS84. If unknown: -1000 m. Used only for s..."
    UNITS "Meters" m
  APPEND_ITEM CATEGORY_EU 8 UINT "When classification_type is MAV_ODID_CLASSIFICATION_TYPE_EU, specifies the ca..."
    STATE MAV_ODID_CATEGORY_EU_UNDECLARED 0
    STATE MAV_ODID_CATEGORY_EU_OPEN 1
    STATE MAV_ODID_CATEGORY_EU_SPECIFIC 2
    STATE MAV_ODID_CATEGORY_EU_CERTIFIED 3
  APPEND_ITEM CLASS_EU 8 UINT "When classification_type is MAV_ODID_CLASSIFICATION_TYPE_EU, specifies the cl..."
    STATE MAV_ODID_CLASS_EU_UNDECLARED 0
    STATE MAV_ODID_CLASS_EU_CLASS_0 1
    STATE MAV_ODID_CLASS_EU_CLASS_1 2
    STATE MAV_ODID_CLASS_EU_CLASS_2 3
    STATE MAV_ODID_CLASS_EU_CLASS_3 4
    STATE MAV_ODID_CLASS_EU_CLASS_4 5
    STATE MAV_ODID_CLASS_EU_CLASS_5 6
    STATE MAV_ODID_CLASS_EU_CLASS_6 7
  APPEND_ITEM OPERATOR_ALTITUDE_GEO 32 FLOAT "Geodetic altitude of the operator relative to WGS84. If unknown: -1000 m."
    UNITS "Meters" m
  APPEND_ITEM TIMESTAMP 32 UINT "32 bit Unix Timestamp in seconds since 00:00:00 01/01/2019."
    UNITS "Seconds" s
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# OPEN_DRONE_ID_MESSAGE_PACK (ID 12915)
# An OpenDroneID message pack is a container for multiple encoded
# OpenDroneID messages (i.e. not in the format given for the above message
# descriptions but after encoding into the compressed OpenDroneID byte
# format). Used e.g. when transmitting on Bluetooth 5.0 Long Range/Extended
# Advertising or on WiFi Neighbor Aware Networking or on WiFi Beacon.
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> OPEN_DRONE_ID_MESSAGE_PACK LITTLE_ENDIAN "An OpenDroneID message pack is a container for multiple encoded OpenDroneID messages (i.e. not in..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 12915} %>
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_SYSTEM 8 UINT "System ID (0 for broadcast)."
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_COMPONENT 8 UINT "Component ID (0 for broadcast)."
  APPEND_ARRAY_ITEM ID_OR_MAC 8 UINT 160 "Only used for drone ID data received from other UAs. See detailed description..."
  APPEND_ITEM SINGLE_MESSAGE_SIZE 8 UINT "This field must currently always be equal to 25 (bytes), since all encoded Op..."
    UNITS "Bytes" B
  APPEND_ITEM MSG_PACK_SIZE 8 UINT "Number of encoded messages in the pack (not the number of bytes). Allowed ran..."
  APPEND_ARRAY_ITEM MESSAGES 8 UINT 1800 "Concatenation of encoded OpenDroneID messages. Shall be filled with nulls in ..."
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# OPEN_DRONE_ID_ARM_STATUS (ID 12918)

# location and other required information. This is streamed by transmitter.
# A flight controller uses it as a condition to arm.
# ============================================================================

  APPEND_ITEM STATUS 8 UINT "Status level indicating if arming is allowed."
    STATE MAV_ODID_ARM_STATUS_GOOD_TO_ARM 0
    STATE MAV_ODID_ARM_STATUS_PRE_ARM_FAIL_GENERIC 1
  APPEND_ITEM ERROR 400 STRING "Text error message, should be empty if status is good to arm. Fill with nulls..."
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# OPEN_DRONE_ID_SYSTEM_UPDATE (ID 12919)
# Update the data in the OPEN_DRONE_ID_SYSTEM message with new location
# information. This can be sent to update the location information for the
# operator when no other information in the SYSTEM message has changed. This
# message allows for efficient operation on radio links which have limited
# uplink bandwidth while meeting requirements for update frequency of the
# operator location.
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> OPEN_DRONE_ID_SYSTEM_UPDATE LITTLE_ENDIAN "Update the data in the OPEN_DRONE_ID_SYSTEM message with new location information. This can be se..."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 12919} %>
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_SYSTEM 8 UINT "System ID (0 for broadcast)."
  APPEND_ITEM TARGET_COMPONENT 8 UINT "Component ID (0 for broadcast)."
  APPEND_ITEM OPERATOR_LATITUDE 32 INT "Latitude of the operator. If unknown: 0 (both Lat/Lon)."
    UNITS "Degrees_E7" degE7
  APPEND_ITEM OPERATOR_LONGITUDE 32 INT "Longitude of the operator. If unknown: 0 (both Lat/Lon)."
    UNITS "Degrees_E7" degE7
  APPEND_ITEM OPERATOR_ALTITUDE_GEO 32 FLOAT "Geodetic altitude of the operator relative to WGS84. If unknown: -1000 m."
    UNITS "Meters" m
  APPEND_ITEM TIMESTAMP 32 UINT "32 bit Unix Timestamp in seconds since 00:00:00 01/01/2019."
    UNITS "Seconds" s
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"

# ============================================================================
# HYGROMETER_SENSOR (ID 12920)
# Temperature and humidity from hygrometer.
# ============================================================================
TELEMETRY <%= target_name %> HYGROMETER_SENSOR LITTLE_ENDIAN "Temperature and humidity from hygrometer."
  <%= render "_mavlink_v2_header_tlm.txt", locals: {msgid: 12920} %>
  APPEND_ITEM ID 8 UINT "Hygrometer ID"
  APPEND_ITEM TEMPERATURE 16 INT "Temperature"
    UNITS "Centidegrees_Celsius" cdegC
  APPEND_ITEM HUMIDITY 16 UINT "Humidity"
    UNITS "Centipercent" c%
  APPEND_ITEM CHECKSUM 16 UINT "CRC-16/MCRF4XX checksum"
    FORMAT_STRING "0x%04X"
